text: I frequent here all the time! I love the atmosphere, the music, the service, the cerveza, and most of all... the Food! Have you heard their "Happy Birthdays"? That's the best Happy Birthday celebration you'll ever hear in a restaurant.
Best mexican place to eat. Great staff and fantastic food. Lunch menu is perfect. One of the best.
excellent food! visitors from out of town alway ask to go here!

Excellent food and service. Large portions great value. We tried 2 of the combo meals and the carne asada taco meal.  Very flavorful and fresh.  The reviews are accurate and I would totally recommend and come here again

Wow! Good food and very fast. I went in Tuesday at 1pm. Still a big lunch crowd but my chicken enchiladas were to my table within 5 minutes. I also took a carne asada burrito to go. Great chips, salsa and bean dip!
Fantastic atmosphere, great service and the food was delicious. I've finally found a good Mexican restaurant in Vegas!  3 years later...

Absolutely the very best Mexican food restaurant I have ever been to, anywhere. Out of everything that has ever been ordered between myself, my husband, and any of our friends and family we have come here with, no one has ever had anything bad. This place is amazing from the food to the service. Customer for life, without a doubt. I even bought a few of their shirts! :P

Been coming here for years. Definitely one of the best Mexican food restaurants in North LV. The fajitas and fresh guacamole are especially good. Customer service is usually great but can drop off during busy times. Highly recommended!

My boyfriend and I went to Vegas and coming From a Mexican families down south of Texas.... as south as you can get, I was a little skeptical eating Mexican food here. We decided to take the risk and were impressed. The service was excellent and so fast! The food, although differently prepared, was delicious. I had never had enchiladas that were filled with shredded beef. My honey absolutely loved his food also. We were almost going to ask for someone to roll us out...that's how much we ate. I will admit that the sopapillas were a little thicker than what I'm used to but still very good. Definitely recommended!!
I absolutely love this place, the staff are wonderful and this is the best authentic Mexican food in Las Vegas hands down!!

My daughter & I went for lunch and there was only 1 server with a large party of 12 people sitting next to us, it took over 40 minutes to get fish tacos & chimichanga, I had complained prior to getting food and came down with food poisoning the next day!! I would NOT eat there!!
I have yet to find a superior Mexican joint in Las Vegas.  Service is also great.  Atmosphere is also very nice.  It is not in a great part of town, so watch yourself.  Margarita selection is good.

I think it's too expensive for the type of food served. I've been there a couple of time and food is ok. Service is good and I guess it takes the usual time time prepare food as any other Mexican restaurant. Not bad for the family.

I ate here with my family and it was a great experience. We were immediately greeted and seated so it wasn't too busy on a Sunday afternoon. Their service was AMAZING. Our waitress was super nice and our chips, salsa, and water kept getting refilled when needed. It took a while for our main entrees but it was worth it. I ordered flautas with beans and rice. The flautas were crispy but soft at the same time. It had a nice balance to it. The rice and beans weren't too bad as well! I was soo full but it was from eating too much of those chips!! lol Overall my fam and I enjoyed the meal, service, and ambiance of this restaurant. I would definitely come back again and hello...there's live music too!! :)

Food is decent.  Yummy guac made at the table. The meal itself was ok. However I cannot in good conscience give high stars to a restaurant who limits a military discount to "just the active duty member". If you are going to offer a discount it should be extended to their family members at the table also. Not just the military members meal. Seriously?! Who does that? We used to get the discount off the whole ticket. Not sure when that changed. Been going to this restaurant ages. Going to rethink that now. There are plenty of other options in Mexican cuisine. Those who do offer the "whole" table... children and the spouses of military a discount without them being present. It may seem I'm being petty over a few dollars. It's just the way I was treated when I enquired. When I took my children without my husband. Shame on this restaurant being so close to a military installation and being this stingy. Especially when every time I go their is plenty of military handing over their money. Keeping this business open.

The food here is always great. The staff is always nice and attentive. Today I placed an order to go and was disappointed.  I ordered the flautas meal.  They gave me all the fixings to put my meal together. It was tasty however the gave me chicken when I ordered beef.  There's nothing worse than expecting something and biting into something else.

Appetizer came the same time as our entree (after an hour) ,  all the food was cold,  and the buss boy spilled my food on me. The place is also so family friendly everywhere I looked there was a crying child. Two stars cause the food would have been good if it was hot.

If you are looking for Mexican food in North Las Vegas, this is the best! There are so many Mexican Restaurants in the area, sit down and fast food, it can be a little overwhelming. My husband and I have tried many of the different options, and used Yelp to guide us, and we have enjoyed our trips here every time! (We are very picky when it comes to our Mexican food.) It has authentic Mexican food, live music on the weekends, a very friendly staff, and a great atmosphere.   Parking can be a little tight when they are busy, so I would try and come a little earlier if you can.

Great atmosphere and great service.  The food is really good.  I always order the "Doce" for lunch and I'm never disappointed.  Great for small and large griups.  One of my gotos off the strip.  If your also thirsty they have some of the best Margueritas in vegas.

We went here for the first time based on yelps reviews and all I can say is it was excellent. Yes, The parking is poor, and not very many tables inside, but they seated us quickly and parking issues won't keep me from a good meal. All of the employees were very polite and helpful. The guy playing the guitar and singing was great. The food was excellent and service was quick. Nothing bad to say at all. On second thought, it was horrible. All you people stay away so it doesn't get too busy and I can go more often.

Terrific service and great authentic food! Fresh guacamole made at your table.  Despite being super busy the waiter noticed I got a red smothered tamale and offered to replace it! Shows attention to customer and detail. When I come to Vegas I will always come here to eat! Yum!!!!
The bomb.coldest modelo beer on tap ever in town. when you come here you are treated like family.was blown away with the service.it deserve 10 stars

This was definitely not a restaurant I would have tried had I not read the reviews on yelp first.  It's not in the best neighborhood and looks rundown from the outside.  I have now learned that appearances mean nothing.   The food was fantastic, and that's coming from someone who is not a big fan of Mexican food.   I had the tacos design Carne Asada and they were wonderful. The meat was so tender it melts in your mouth.  Add that to homemade tortillas and tortilla chips, and you can't go wrong.

This place is amazing! We happened to find it when we were staying just a few blocks away for Electric Daisy Carnival & immediately fell in love!  The food is delicious, large portions, authentic Mexican food, & friendly/attentive staff!  The chili rellenos are incredible, the cilantro steak was the best cilantro dish I've ever had & the drinks are cheap. The prices here are very reasonable (we had drinks, an appetizer, and two entrees for $50). We were in Vegas for 4 days & visited Viva Zapatas twice, we will be back next summer & intend to visit this place again.  Also, the decor is very tasteful and interesting to look at & avoids the cheesiness that many restaurants get into. The thing we liked the most about this place is that it's a bit out of the way but they really focus on a comfortable, friendly atmosphere, which you don't really find on the strip.

When I went, there was live music and I really loved the authentic feel to it. The food was amazing with generous portions and the customer service was quick and excellent. I never had an empty glass of water through the entire meal. The only thing I didn't like was the dirty sticky menus but I'll live.

We were looking for place to celebrate my moms birthday! My husband remembered this place he visited few months ago and i checked reviews on yelp and decided to give it a try. I couldn't be happier!!! Delicious Food! Live music! The most friendly customer service! We had sooo much fun!! Their guacamole is a must!! And Margaritas are the best!!! Highly recommended!!!

It sucked! Very nice inside that's pretty much it. Long  Wait, over crowded,by the way 100 capacity.burnt shrimp, yup sucks. I really don't like these types of places. I'm Mexican,so I know what a simple enchilada is supposed to taste like look Like even smell like.for example, they American up authentic dishes with American cheese instead of queso cotija or queso fresco, come on! Velveta cheese on enchilada?
I had the Carne Asada villa, hubby had three carne Asada tacos.  Everything was delicious!
Amazing food, drinks, live music, and service! You will not be disappointed! Great atmosphere for a date or to watch the game at the bar. I would make a trip to Vegas just to come here again.
Service was excellent. Our server Ramon!!! Was the best. Environment was great food Outstanding thanks....

This place has the best, margarita's like fish bowl size!! and have every tequila you can imagine. they start you with fresh chips from cooker and serve you up, a assortment of salsa 3 to be exact!!! Shrimp cocktail is with monster prawns !!! I had a enchilada & shredded taco dinner !!! It was very tasty!!! and filling! I recommend this place even if it's just for shot's of tequila & beer, at the bar !! nice decor & good service!
The soup starter and service was great. However, the margaritas were very disappointing and could stand to have a little more tequila.
I'm still here waiting, 45 min now for 6 tacos, not even combo orders, simple orders but they lack the urgency to wait on customers,I will not be back

Amazing Mexican restaurant!  The food here is all authentic and is some of the most delicious Mexican food I have ever had.  They serve unlimited chips and salsa with hot bean dip!  The tacos were outstanding and the prices on the lunch portions were very good.  We went again for dinner 2 days later and the food was just as outstanding as the first time around.  They also had live music when we went for dinner (Friday night).  Musician was very good and definitely contributed to the wonderful ambiance at this restaurant.

The beans.... Oh the beans! And they're complimentary. Along with the Fideo soup. Oh, man! I would eat just that, it makes me so nostalgic for meals from my past.  With that said, everything we have tried has been very good. We have been here a few times and have not been disappointed. The parking lot is a hot mess and the seating area is small but once you sit down and they bring the complimentary beans, salsa, chips and soup I am already so happy that I end up ordering a small meal to share with someone! So if you want to get off the strip and have a good, more authentic Mexican meal head over to Viva Zapatas!

Looking for food poisoning while in Vegas? Well then this is your one stop shop! I went with a party of four and we all woke up vomiting the next day. The food is far from authentic, unless you consider tainted chicken authentic.
Loved it. We had pork burrito with green sauce and cheese enchiladas.  The food takes a while to come out,  but tastes like made to order.  Worth it!

It was my first visit here, and I was solo, so naturally I took a seat at the bar so as not to take up an entire table or booth.  The bartender/waitress was super nice and the salad I ordered was amazing (chicken, avocado, something delicious in a ranch cesar type dressing)!  I was only drinking an Arnold Palmer since I had to drive but I was not rushed from the bar and that was much appreciated.  There was also a great singer with his guitar (not too loud and complementary to the atmosphere).  There seemed to be many happy hour specials on drinks and I hope to partake on my next visit into town.

What a great ambiance!  Came here for dinner on Saturday night.  They had the mariachis playing sappy songs.  You have a lady sitting behind a glass window, making fresh tortillas, patting them down back and forth between her hands.  It was a very interesting atmosphere.  I had ordered the mole (pronounced molli).  It was an interesting concoction of spices.  And to end the meal, I had their deep-fried ice cream.  I know...talk about calorie-city.    But love, love, love this place.

The food here was really good and they have a singer playing soft spanish music which was nice after a long weekend of partying :) The only negative thing I have to say is the wait was ridiculous. We were a party of 12 and we waiting for our food to come out for about an hour and 20 minutes. Besides that it was really good

A-OK.  Even though I may occasionally forget my own definition of the terms, I believe there is a difference between food and cuisine.  Respectively, this is the difference from just getting some yummy eats and a dining, gastronomical experience.  Typically, I also have a problem with this, because I find cuisine only marginally more enjoyable, and sometimes, I disagree that it justifies the price-hike.  I'm a foody -- not a cuisine-y.  Yet, if we can turn a $6 burger into a $60 burger by changing the meat, I guess it would be hypocritical to say a difference in use of cheese, tomato, and corn can make cuisine.  Anyway, I came here thinking I was just going to get some Mexican food, but instead I found myself getting some Mexican cuisine.  I'm not saying I was disappointed, but I wasn't pleasantly surprised either.  Usually when dealing with cuisine, it means you have to also wait a little longer to get in and get out.  Here was no different.  I just wouldn't figure the place next to a gas station as classy, but the place really is quite so.  The staff is very professional; the bar is VERY well stocked with tequila; and the decor is above-par.  Though you do have to pay for all this in the end.  Unfortunately, I broke my own rule for trying a Mexican establishment new to me: I usually get carnitas so I have an equal point of comparison.  Instead I got the taco salad off their lunch menu because of a recommendation, and because I wasn't looking to spend as much as I could have here.  While I we waited, we got the obligatory chips and salsa.  As a special note, they also provide frijoles without having to ask for it.  I decided to go one further, and asked to have some salsa verde as well.  The salsa verde here comes out piping hot, but either way, all three were pretty good dips.  The taco salad comes in either beef or chicken, and I opted for the latter.  A risky decision as most of my experiences with shredded white meat chicken have been unappetizingly dry, but the waiter assured me.  He was no liar.  Possibly the best execution of Mexican shredded chicken I've tasted to date.  The size of the whole thing wasn't too bad, but for the price, I probably should try something else next time.  So for not quite being my thing, I still enjoyed myself enough.

This is the best Mexican restaurant I've had in a long time. If I could I would come back here to dine again.  I had the "taco de lengua " although it was small it definitely made up in its taste. There was live music by one guy wich was amazing.  I think that the interior design was nice with all of the items on the wall.
This place is great! My husband & I love the enchilladas and margargaritas - they even make their own chips!

I'm not sure where to start...the food is passable but not great. Fish tacos were slightly less flavorful than frozen in a box. Child Colorado was bland, meat was tough and dry, chips were stale, salsa had no kick. It's not clear how, with so many tables free, there were no tables. We sat at the bar. The service was good.
Best Mexican food I've had in Las Vegas.  Really good service during a busy lunch hour. Chips and tortillas are made fresh, good salsa and guacamole too!

I'll tell you what, this place looks like nothing from the outside, but when you get inside, you will discover the best service I have had in three years of living in vegas, that includes restaurants that cost 3x as much.   The food is outstanding, Their chicken mole is out of this world good.  Don't miss out on their mojitos, better than any restaurant in key west!
Love this Mexican Restaurant. Everything was so good. Gorge helped us and he was nice and professional. We will be going again on our next Vegas trip.
This place is amazing ! The food is delicious and the service is phenomenal ! The chile verde is soooo delicious
Fanfreakingtastic food. The atmosphere is amazing, service is outstanding, prices are very reasonable.
I've  been here a few times and the food is consistently good. Great lunch specials. Nice portions. Can't  go wrong eating  here.

I come here every so often. It's never been impressive or exquisitely good. The service is always just ok and the food is always borderline ok. However today I went and ordered their chilaquiles with steak, the difference with steak and without is 8 dollars, so I expected a nice piece of meat. When the food arrived I was surprise with a piece of meat that was so small I was unable to classify the cut the server said it is a 4 ounce piece but I would hesitate to say it was more than 2 ounces. We spoke to the manager and they reiterated that it was the right size I refused to pay and just stuck with my chilaquiles. I never expect much but this time it was just outrageously bad servings and service.

Diamond in the rough!!  I've tried many of their dishes and they are all authentic and leave me so full I can hardly move! I love that they have a fresh tortilla making station right there in the dining room as well as the live music, However as much as these things are fantastic in my view, my favorite part is their margaritas. They have many flavors and everyone of them are delish!

Best Mexican restaurant in town and a local favorite. They have a full bar and a wide variety of lunch specials. Try the guacamole; they make it at your table. Great food and even better service. I'm a regular and am never disappointed.
Dope spot,dranks r good,food is good...nice mellow place if ur not tryna go to las islitas or something.
Love this place, always have great food and amazing service. I never leave disappointed.
I saw the reviews and they were good.   So, I thought I would give it a try. Very slow service and when the food finally came out it was  lukewarm.   Nothing special here.
I've eaten authentic quality Mexican food in Mexico, and tonight's meal is a flash in the past to the level of freshness, spice, flavor, and authenticity of my favorite local dishes.

This is a great place for lunch. The lunch specials are well priced and the salads are great. We came in with a party of 6 at 12:15pm and had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. The service was very quick and professional. My iced tea was constantly refilled when the server noticed that my glass was half full.

Great food service and vibes! Love this place! I've been going here for years including my graduation dinner! I love the bean and salsa dips the soup is amazing! I recommend the carne asada tacos (: they have never failed me.

If you are in Vegas, and you want really delicious mexican food, you owe it to yourself to eat here.  The first time I had the Cochinita a la naranja, and the second time I had Pollo en Pipian. Both were fantastic, and the horchata (free refills!) was delicious.  Seriously, eat here.
Just driving through, and needed a good place to eat, so I turned to yelp. Muchas gracias! We LOVED THIS PLACE! Good drinks, good food, good entertainment!

Love Zapatas!!! They have live music and amazing food. My husband is Hispanic and he said it almost matches his mom's cooking. The wait staff was very professional, and the people who come between the waiters are great you never have an empty drink. Love the complimentary bean dip/salsa and chips. My daughter is one and loves the music!

The wait staff and management were very courteous but the food was not tasty at all. For it to be Mexican food it was very bland and had no flavor to it. The staff saved it from being rated with one star.

We like Zapatas very much. I've eaten there about 50 times. It is good Mexican food for a reasonable price. All of the food is good and Dinners come with soup. Lunch menu is available until 5pm and save you a couple bucks but without soup. Happy hour goes til 6pm, and they have a few drink specials. Dinner is nice because they have live music. Good atmosphere. Actually would like to give it a 4.5 stars and think that it is one of the best mexican restaurants in Las Vegas and one of the best restaurants overall in the North East part of the City!

Bad experience with this restaurant!!  I order carnitas and it look like pork chops no taste at all!!!! And the food server did not show up at all to se if everything was alright!!! The only good experience we had was at the bar! The girl or the bartender was nice!!  We won't go back there!!!!!
I had the 7 mares caldo. Great taste. The caldo had a lot of sea food.  service was also great. Got seated right away. Hey also had this amazing salsa. I'll be back to try the camarones.
Viva Zapatas Mexican food is the best Mexican food we've had since moving to west coast from NY

Great food...great service!  If you don't know how to eat Mexican food with a flour tortilla you don't belong in this restaurant.  The complimentary chips, salsa, retried beans, are awesome.  I recommend the homemade guacamole.  It is made fresh right at your table.  I Ordered the mochacca breakfast and enjoyed it.  Next time I'm back in Vegas I will definitely try the dinner menu.

Went for Lunch - The Staff while professional did not seem happy to be there. I and several other non-Spanish speaking groups were left to our own  instinct with the wait staff unwilling to explain the menu without giving the non-welcoming attitude that we were just too much trouble. So I ordered the Cognac Chicken while my wife ordered the Beef Tacos. The "Chips" delivered to the table were either old or cooked/re-fried at too low a temperature since they were Oily. The Bean dip was average and the tomato based dipping sauce was a dark, hot, bitter,  variety that is unique to this place. The Cognac Chicken cooked with canned mushrooms and onions actually had a strange sweet taste and the accompanying Rice and Beans were nothing special. The place was very clean as I observed one cook diligently changing gloves when interrupted at her station (excellent). I can't say anything really Great NOR Bad about this place, however I would not go out of my way to eat here as there are so many better options for the price. $ 45.00 for two counting Tip - No Alcohol, Appetizer nor Dessert.

Delicious food and great ambience!  We were on a road trip heading south looking for lunch close to the 15 freeway.  Thanks, Yelp, for bringing us here!  We were pleased right off the bat with the warm tortilla chips, hot bean dip, and salsa as soon as we sat down.  We're suckers for tableside guacamole, which was great as well.  The portions were huge - we only needed two entrees to feed me, my wife, and our two kids.  We got the fish tacos and the combination with a chili relleno and green chile pork burrito.  My only criticism of the food is that the peppers they used for the relleno were VERY mild and I like them to have a bit more punch.  The kids enjoyed the live mariachi and had fun watching them make the tortillas fresh behind a window in the corner of the restaurant.  All in all a pleasant meal and we were back on the freeway quickly.
Wonderful food, atmosphere, service!!!  I only came because of yelp reviews.  Thank you!
Fast and friendly service. My glass was never empty and chips and salsa never stopped. Highly recommend!!

My sister had been wanting to come here for awhile. We finally went! I had the fish tacos(I wasn't a vegetarian yet and am not sure how friendly this place might be on that). I thought they were wonderful. A little different from what I was used to, but different isn't always bad. I loved the bean dip, salsa, and chips that was brought to our table while we waited as well. The service was fast and the place smells amazing. The atmosphere was great. There was a musician playing beautiful music, and the decorations covering the walls were interesting too.
Worst mexican food ever. Bad service, crappy margaritas, poor quality of food. Had to ask to order, ask for the check. Never coming back.
Not bad for East Coast Mexican.  Mole is worth it. Don't let the outside appearance fool you.

Went there for a dinner. Place was very reminicent of the kind of mexican restaurants my folks use to take me to growing up. Interior had very dim lighting, decor was appropriate, not over done. A nice break from the chain eateries. Ordered a combo and the tacos won! The best I have had since the Taco vans down in SoCal. Also, a must is the prepared to order guacamole. The waiter made it table-side, with input from us. It was delicious. Service was excellant, and noticed they had homemade sangria...For next time. A great place and kid friendly too. Also, the salsa and bean dip they put on the table with the warm chips was excellant too. Very nice a la carte menu, so easy to make it a $ instead of a $$.
Bomb AF Mexican food!!! Prices are fair, comes with chips, salsa, & super dank bean dip!!! Large portions!!

Viva Zap is the type of restaurant I love to frequent.  It's not part of a chain, most likely a mom and pop (and grandma and grandpa) establishment that doesn't serve fast food, but good food fast.  Growing up, I didn't have the maturity to eat other cuisines. Having lived near the Mexican border years back, I had access to this incredible food made by people who took humble ingredients and made them taste great. Mexican isn't one of my favorite cuisines, but I appreciate it being available when I have that urge.  I originally wanted to get menudo, but it's only available on the weekends. Instead, I picked what I remember from the menu as "goat soup" or something. Braised goat meat in I believe is a tomato-based liquid.  Was a tasty meal, but I left looking like a crime scene happened on my clothing. Good thing I tend to wear darker hued clothes. Was going to order the quacamole, but thought against it, too much food for me to eat.  Will go again.

I had not been to this restaurant in over 6 years. I walked in today just to be treated by a rude hostess. She claimed there were no tables available but everyone that came in after me was seated promptly. I waited around but I was never offered a table. We ended up leaving. I don't think ill be returning any time soon.
Food was great! Guacomole made in front of you was amazing. Tortillas with carne asada very good. The red salsa was ok with chips. But, great customer service!
One of my favorite places for authentic Mexican food in LV! Love coming here with the fam!
This place is really good... They brought our kids out some "fideo" soup as an appetizer. I love the tortilla lady in the back of the restaurant making fresh tortillas by hand... Yummmm...

Good, plentiful Mexican food. Hot, fresh chips with complimentary bean dip and salsa, although I prefer pico de gallo style rather than the tomato sauce-based offering here. (Pro tip: mix the salsa into the bean dip and add a little pinch of salt.) The service is great and everyone was friendly. The restaurant's super dark, though; we had to crack the blinds to see the menu (hey, our eyes aren't as young as they used to be).
The food is VERY good and priced just right. Staff is friendly and attentive. I love the atmosphere and even though its small you don't feel like other parties are sitting on top of you.

Beans and salsa are good but my husband is not a fan of them.  I got the chile rellenos and bean enchiladas they were good.   They had cheese on the beans that was too much cheese for me.  Chicken enchiladas were good  Cheviche de camaron was good

Can I put no stars?? Goodness, I have been coming for over 16 years, never has the service been this horrible! I get it your busy it's a Sunday but passing by our table numerous times and barely acknowledging us is just rude.  We sat down and waited for our drinks over 5 minutes to get asked what we wanted, had to ask to get soup! Finally after order was taken we waited over 40 minutes. Two families, of 4 mind you,  sat down after us  and were done eating and paid their bill and yet we were still waiting on our food!  Finally when we decided to get up and leave that's when we were asked and told our food would be coming out shortly! Seriously that is what it takes for someone to show courtesy and tend to you!  Oh and get this I walk back to get managers card and name, I'm standing there hearing them talk and the man has the balls to state he had informed us our food was already coming, I CORRECTED HIM, YES YOU TOLD US OUR FOOD WAS COMING WHEN WE GOT UP TO LEAVE! BEFORE YOU LIE MAKE SURE THE PERSON ISN'T STANDING RIGHT IN FORNT OF YOU!
Strong drinks, amazing food, revolutionary decor... What more could you ask for? So happy I came here!

We enjoyed this Mexican Restaurant.  The food and the service was good.  We ordered a Mexican Shrimp DIsh, Glazed Chicken and Carne Asada Tacos and all was very good.  Live music played while we ate dinner which was very nice.  We all left very full and satisfied.  The price was right and I would suggest trying this restaurant some time.

I'm conflicted about my review. I would give it a 2.5. The parking is terrible like everyone says. The salsa was really good. The live music was a nice touch. The food was just OK. I have had better Mexican food and I've had worse. I'm always suspicious of a Mexican restaurant when it is chock full of White people and no, or very few Mexican-Americans.   My husband liked his shrimp dish, but my pork dish was meh, unmemorable. I took home most of it and gave it to my husband. He will eat almost anything. I would not order a pork dish there again.   I don't know if we will be going back again, definitely not at a busy time when parking is difficult.

Very good food, friendly service and a great atmosphere. Be prepared to wait a bit and service can be a little slow when packed but not too bad. Food is probably the best, freshest Mexican I've had in Las Vegas so far.
Great restaurant, great food, great service.  The bartender, Jackie, makes a great Margarita!
Fantastic! We tried this place based on yelp and tripadvisor reviews and all the great reviews were right!  The service is outstanding and the food is awesome. We will be back:-)
Great food and very authentic atmosphere. We usually go on weekends, and they always have live music playing. Usually just a guy and his guitar, but he's very good.

Great atmosphere, good food. Would give this place one or two more stars if the waiter would've bothered to come back to check on me after setting my plate on the table. My cup sat empty for 20 minutes. And it's not like he was busy, considering it was only me and another table behind me. Everyone else was great.

Wow! I have been to several Mexican restaurants in my day, this one stands out from the norm. The staff was very friendly and provided excellent service from beginning to end. The menu selection is one of the most impressive and biggest I have ever seen with regional variations to their entrees. There was no feel of commercial big-chain restaurants and the musician playing guitar and singing older traditional songs by the entrance made the place feel complete. My visiting family enjoyed every thing we ordered and I wish I had ordered the table side guacamole after seeing it made at the next table. I WILL go back there.
The food here is awesome and authentic. My favorite here is the cilantro ribeye. If you're ever in Las Vegas I would highly recommend trying this restaurant.

I have tried several Mexican food places in Las Vegas. This place is convenient and close to my house. The food is always good. Some times the servers can get a bit bogged down and can slow service. Parking here when the place is full is a pain. Over all a good place to grab some Mexican food if you live up North

Out of all of the Lindo Michoacan and whatever locations they have Viva Zapata is the best love this place been here many many times always will have my business and the consistency from the staff to customer service is off the charts I wish I can give you 10 stars but the best I could do with this v definition this place out if you were on Pecos and Craig

WOW!!! This place is a amazing. My husband and I have been here several times and it has never disappointed!! As soon as you sit down they bring you yummy chips, salsa and a spicy brean dip! Make sure you order the fresh avocado dip...they literally cut the avocados and make the dip right at your table!! This place is SO clean and the service is so on point it will blow your mind. Make sure you tip The guitar man!!!!

Finally getting around to reviewing this godsend of a restaurant.  I've had Mexican food in Tijuana, Texas, California, and Florida.  This place is simply amazing!  Starting off with the chips, salsa, and bean dip the food here is excellent.  Their salsa has a unique flavor...very distinct and tasty!  Everything is served fresh!  The staff works very well together and will gladly assist even if you are not their table.  Whoever is running this place is doing a great job.  We came here at least 5 times during our visit and always left satisfied.  Everything we tried was good.  We only visited for dinner so I can't comment on the lunch.  My personal favorite was the tacos al pastor.  I highly recommend this place.

I really like their food.  But, there is no parking, and spending an hour looking for a place on a busy street is no longer worth it.  There is also usually a waiting line, which moves rather quickly, but there is no place to wait.  People are stacked on top of each other or outside.  There are other Mexican restaurants and I think I'm going to find on.  I wish they would find a better location.

The first time I went there I got enchiladas and they weren't that great so about a year went by and I decided to try them again and end up getting a different plate, it was the nachos on the appetizer and it was so good. The Margaritas are worth trying at least once if you ever go. I got a nice buzz off of just one so they don't skip out on the liquor.

Was here last night & as always it was awesome. For my last meal on the states for awhile it certainly was the perfect choice. My wife loves it here & we dine here so often they know her order. Lol while the parking leaves a bit to be desired & lord knows it on the edge of the world it well worth venturing out of your comfort zone for easily the best Mexican Food Vegas has to offer.

In the culinary wasteland known as East Craig Road, this is the sole exception.  It is in close proximity to Nellis AFB so if you get here right at 11, you can have a quick lunch with your significant other!  Complimentary chips, beans, and salsa, friendly bartenders, colorful Mexican decorations, and live Spanish guitar.    My wife enjoys the cheese enchiladas with chicken mole combo and I like the pollo correteado.  The sole drawback is the limited parking which I solve by parking on the otherwise of the adjacent gas station and Capriotti's.  One of the best Mexican Restaurants in Las Vegas, despite its location.
Excellent food.  Pretty authentic.  Negra Modelo on tap.  Flour tortillas made by hand.  Service was fast

I think I was the only person in Vegas who has not part-taken from this hidden local gem.  I've heard all great things from everyone over the years but never had the chance to experience it.    We met some friends there on Friday night.  The parking was a nightmare.  They had a huge section chained off where I believe alot of their customers usually park.  We ended up parking at the 7/11 and our friends had to park across the street in a vacant lot.  There was a 20 minute wait and there were people everywhere inside and outside waiting.  We decided to get a drink at the bar.  The bar is big however every seat was taken.  There were some 2 seat high tables on the side so we decided to grab one and just order drinks at the bar.  So taking a look around I felt like I took one step into Mexico.  Colorful flags draped the ceilings. The d√©cor is fabulous.  I was already sold one minute into the place. There were a couple large parties which occupied a lot of their tables and a lot of their attention...which is probably reason for everyone waiting in the front.  We were finally seated and immediately served fresh chips, salsa and bean dip.  All of it was fantastic.  The warm bean dip was my favorite.  The BF and I ordered the chicken fajitas to share and the tortillas were fresh and homemade.  It was just enough food for us with all the chips we ate! ;).    Ambiance - Beautiful authentic Spanish atmosphere!  Service - as quick and attentive as they could be being there was a full house and large parties.  Food - a definite score.  And Parking - a bummer but we lived.  Overall good time had by all!  It wasn't just a meal it was an experience!  Totally whole heartedly recommended!  We will be back soon.
Good food nice place but no place to park at all.just a waste of time waiting for a parking spot.space for 15 cars maybe

Went there on recommendation from yelp, was not disappointed. We went early evening so the place was not full yet, but had quite a few tables taken. We were seated quickly and the waiter appeared almost immediately. Drinks came out quickly and the waiter waited until we had decided on dinner before approaching us for our order, a refreshing change from the usual hovering around and rushed feeling. The meal was outstanding, just enough spice heat to enhance the flavor not overpower it. Some might want  more heat, but for me this was just right. The table was cleared AFTER we finished each course by very attentive wait assistants, nice touch to wait, not hover. Overall service was great and food was outstanding,  Only have one downside, the lighting is dim and makes reading the menu challenging. The print on some parts of the menu is the same color as the lighting, so there is no contrast. Those of us who have a little trouble seeing in dim light might want to bring a small light. I would still  highly recommend VIVA ZAPATAS.

Always great food and service whenever we go.  The fresh made tortillas are excellent.  The atmosphere has a more authentic feel than most regular/generic Mexican restaurants.  There is live music, a bar and interesting decor.  Viva Zapatas falls in the medium price range.
Great authentic Mexican food.  Staff is friendly and on point.  Good customer service.

Went here during a recent trip to Vegas, but forgot to write the review.  I want to make sure to give this business its due. This is not an area I typically visit while in town. My usual hotel wasn't able to accommodate my third night (a busy Friday) and I wound up choosing a place that had great reviews. That decision was a good one, and I followed it up by trying out Viva Zapatas due to its following on Yelp. First the bad - parking. Located adjacent to a busy service station, the parking is extremely limited. I actually waited several minutes while two people were talking outside their respective cars. I am glad I had the patience. The title should be reversed; it's a cantina & restaurant. The vibe, even on a weekday lunch, is lively, especially with the sporting events on the TVs. I actually sat at the bar -- there was a short wait for tables. But my server was quick, friendly and efficient. It took a while to get through the menu; I love tough choices.  I wound up choosing the Ayoxustla combo (chile relleno & beef taco) and enjoyed everything. It was tasty, filling and the service was excellent.  I'll come back again. It's worth the extra few minutes to enjoy a really good meal.

I recently visited Zapatas on my latest visit to North Vegas. I went on a Friday night around 830 and YES this place had a very long wait. The parking area is pretty big which is a plus and its very good access for entering and exiting. My only complaint was there is hardly any place to sit when you are waiting for your food. There are two small benches on the inside and maybe two on the outside.  Most people sit in their car or on the little stoop outside the restaurant. Upon entering I was greeted by two lovely hostesses who gave me a menu since I wanted to take my food to go. I decided to sit at the bar and order my food. The bartender was amazing...................although they don't have a drink menu they have a FULLY STOCKED BAR......with some of the best tequila hands down. I had the Peach Margarita first and the alcohol was not scarce :-D. After less than 5 minutes of sitting at the bar we were given Chips, Salsa, and bean dip with cheese. It was so delicious and the chips were fresh and crunchy. The salsa had a little kick to it but I love things spicy...........  Around 20 minutes later I received my food.......I ordered Shrimp and Steak tacos with a side of Chicken tamales...........The steak tacos were pretty good the meat was flavorful and the tortillas were soft..........i did not care for the salsa that came with the tacos  but it wasn't bad........The Shrimp tacos were the highlight of my meal....the shrimp was plump and had just the right seasoning on them .......I immediately fell in love I wish I would have ordered more...... the onions and lettuce was fresh as well .....I don't think I have had shrimp tacos that were that good in a long time.......the tamales were good I wish it had more sauce on them but not too bad......they also came with olives on them which were pretty good. Overall I give this place a 4.......definitely worth coming back for a night out with the ladies for some good food and awesome drinks! If you are near Nellis AFB you surely have to try this place out!

This is the best Mexican food on this side of town.  The Pescado Eufimio Zapata has a wine based sauce, with Spanish olives, that is the best I've ever had.  They also have decent priced lunch specials on weekdays.

I love this place. Awesome atmosphere, there was a guy playing guitar in the entrance. The steaks are always good, good quality and they are served with a bunch of sides that are just delicious. Big portions, you are def not gonna get out of there hungry. Fair prices.  Last time i went there i ordered the steak burracho, includes 2-3 sides and included in the price you get tortillas. All this for $18. Service is phenomenal the waiters are always nice and the cips with salsa and bean sauce are just amazing :)  If you end up in North Las Vegas do yourself a favor and stop there!

I was very impressed with the items they had here. for lunch there are numorous specials. I had the table side guacamole and nachos. the guacamole was worth it. I will for sure be back. the service was gracious and the place was packed.

The food is great pero watch for the outrageous up sale on margaritas. Seriously, $25 for a margarita?  Talk about rip off!! When asked he chuckled, wow! This is one time that I was the tonto gringo. That part of this family business just sucks. I think that banner with "best in LV "dates back to 2012 for a reason. Guess that's why the banner is still up.
Absolutely the BEST Mexican food I've ever eaten! Margaritas were awesome too. Happy Hour 2 for 1

Outstanding service, outstanding food,  interesting location.  This is a very good Mexican restaurant that caters to old and young alike.  Their dishes are all made from scratch and, though I've only tried the chimichanga, I would recommend and return.
Food was amazing and the service was better than amaZing. Can't go wrong with some live Mexican music!

Amazing Authentic Mexican Food. Eat here every time I visit Nellis AFB Quality & Price right on. Great service and ambiance. Gracie is great behind the bar, always friendly and attentive. Greet you with their signature Chips, Salsa & Beans to start. Never disappoints. I highly recommend the #1 Combo. Good Job Team..Viva Zapata's....
The atmosphere is fun and inviting but they use fake chicken or canned chicken it's not fresh. I personally think it is disgusting chicken even though the rest of the food is wonderful

I love this place before you get seated they give you warm beans dip...  chips and salsa ...and warm tomato soup.  I'm nearly feel before I even order anything off the menu. The table side fresh avocado made in front of you is amazing... love that stuff like homemade.

Yummy!  Accidently came upon Zapatas.  What a great Vegas Find!  Food was delicious, service was top notch, and the margarita was yummy!  Some dishes were a little pricy, but you get what you pay for!!  Definiately a repeat visit next time Im in Vegas!!

Excellent Ambience and Food. Must have is their Guacamole which is prepared right in front of your eyes. Horchata is another speciality. If you feel Salsa is less spicy, ask for Habanero Sauce. There are 3 Vegetarian dishes available too, though you can also customise their other items to be without meat.The freshly prepared warm Taco Shells and Burrito Wraps, just amazing. Must go place for Mexican Food lovers! The con is the waiting time in evening and slightly pricier menu.
This place is always consistant with good tasty food. Now all my family goes there. Service, atmosphere, food, WOW! SO good, will return.

Since Dora Maria's closed down just down the road, those of us on Nellis craving good Mexican food had to find a new place to go.  Well, Viva Zapatas does not dissappoint at all.  I have tried about 10 different dishes and they all have been outstanding.    My personal favorite has got to be the chicken chimichanga (enchilada style).  Everything they prepare is fresh, and awesome.  I highly recommend this place.

Other yelpers will disagree, but I think this is the best Mexican restaurant in town. The food, decor, and service are all top notch.  I love the little things about this restaurant. Guacamole is made table side, tortillas are crispy yet chewy, chicken breasts are butterflied, and the salsa is spicy without being overwhelming. Everything adds up to create an enjoyable dining experience.  Of particular note is the mole. It is smooth, rich, complex, and somewhat spicy. The mole is so layered that it is impossible to discern all of the ingredients. However, they blend and play with each other to create something that is close to magic.  For a nice low calorie treat that's sure to delight your Vegan friends, try the Quesa Fundido con Rajas. Ok, so it's not low calorie. But you really should try it at least once a year. The hot cheese wrapped in chewy tortillas is beyond words.  One of my favorite parts about Zapatas is that it is a community restaurant. I always see people in uniform here, whether they are from the police department or Nellis. People meet here after work, come here on dates, and bring their families. We always bring our out of town guests here.   I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.

We came here not expecting much since it's hard to find good Mexican food in town. Boy was I surprised. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas and was surprised how much we got for the money. Then my food was enchiladas. They tasted just like mom's (don't tell her I said that). The service at this place was excellent. Our server Jorge was all over it and we wanted for nothing. The only negative I would say is its really dark in there and at times hard to see the menu. We just busted out our cell phone lights and looked at the menu that way. Go to this place its good!
Do: get the table side guacamole, al pastor taco, carne asada con rajas y crema tacos  Skip: margarita, Chile relleno

Good food. I like to take a friend who knows Mexican food and he orders for me. Service from the drink servers is better than the waiter. One was so excellent I contributed to him directly. When I went alone with the kids, my waiter looked like he had no patience for us. We do not speak Spanish and he treated us like outsiders. I needed help with the menu because it is dark in there and it is hard to read. He was no place around to help. When the waiter finally did come around, he still acted like we were bothering him. So I suggest to take a Spanish speaking person with you when you go. It is too bad for the waiter but the food is good. The prices are on the high side. Minimum $10 for appetizers dinner plates run $15 to $30 a plate.

Their chile relleno was very good, the chips and salsa were good but the pork taco was dry and lacking flavor as was the tamale. One out of three on the main course is not good but the chile relleno was good enough I would go back for that alone. The service was great in the bar area and the beer was cold. I ate at three Mexican restaurants while in Vegas and this was the best. The other two had dry pork as well on their tacos so maybe that is the way they like it in Vegas?!?

There is fast food Mexican food.  There is authentic Mexican food.  Then there is really good authentic Mexican food, and that is what you will get at Viva Zapatas.  The food here is superb.  I adore this place.  They should open a restaurant in SoCal, too!  I stopped here again today on my way home.  Awesome as always.

I asked my local friends to pick a place that locals like.  This is where they chose to take us.    We are used to the Nashville Mexican Food, and this place certainly was so much better than I am used to.  The ambiance was fabulous, with authentic live Mexican music.  Service was prompt and friendly, with generous portions of Nachos.  As an exciting addition to what I'm used to, they include Beans as well as Salsa!  For my entree I had the Tierra Libertad, which was delicious.  They also give you Tortilla, but they are quite large, and I was not really sure HOW you were supposed to eat the meal with the Tortilla.  I would absolutely return!
Everytime I go to Viva Zapatas it feels like home they really know how to provide the best customer service. My favorite dish is pollo zarandeado and ceviche it is delicious you gotta to try it...

Enjoyed the bean dip, soup, and steak dish for dinner last evening. I think everything on this menu would be tasty. This is the second time I have dined here and will be back.  The service was very good and a little of live music in the background.  F
I am so in love with this place. It is the best sit down Mexican restaurant I've been to here. Great service!Being your appetite, you will need it.
The best Mexican Iv'e had to date. YES, even better than Super Mex. Fundido w/ green chile KILLER! Awesome service. Homemade tortillas. Table side guacamole. Real classy place!
Great food with big portions definitely a good choice. They have plenty of food choices. Service was good as well.

Don't let the exterior fool you - next to a gas station & truck stop in NLV - reveals a gem of  restaurant. We came around 1pm for late lunch and we were seated in no time at all. Menu is extensive so it took a while to decide on the Carne ala Coca Cola and Mole Poblano for our entr√©es. While waiting for our food, we nibbled on what seemed like endless tortilla chips, salsa, and bean dip. They had a musician play live music and that definitely lent to a more relaxed atmosphere. Food was very good and we were thankful that we didn't order an appetizer because the portions are fairly large although the table side guacamole was tempting (next time!).  We will definite be back!
There is always a waiting list in the evening but it's always worth it! The food, the service and the atmosphere are great. Tortillas are home made right there. Guacamole is super fresh.

Lighting was really poor, menu description really small, thank goodness for flashlight app. Filled up a little to much on chips and salsa. First brought out soup that was good but all it was is broth. Service slow but they did stop by our table to ask if everything was OK. Good was good, I had Chili Colorado and it was cooked perfectly. I would recommend it if you on that side of town.
Delicious, authentic food.   Cozy atmosphere.  Nice live music.  Service cannot be beat!  Highly recommend for lunch or dinner.  Only suggestion is come early, parking is tight  & seats fill fast!

Unfreakin believable. I give this place a "6" out of 5 stars ! Service was spot on excellent. Food was amazing. Had the " Coca Cola sauce Pasilla Chilies Rib Eye steak, cooked perfectly medium rare. "  It was so tender and flavorful, that I almost ordered another meal to go. Jorge was my waiter and he was one of the best waiters I have ever had, anywhere. Hats off to this family run Mexican gem of a restaurant. Do yourself a treat and visit this establishment. You will not be disappointed!

This is the real deal of Mexican food. Super tasty everything cooked fresh and a tortillas was amazingly soft and flaky.. There was a slight wait in time, but it was well worth it, don't miss out on some great Food. I was super happy and could not finish the portions served.  Find your happiness here.

In Love again! I asked around for a good romantic place to take a date. The name Viva Zapata's kept coming up by friends recommending it. The name didn't sound very romantic, it sounded more revolutionary, but maybe that's what I needed some kind of revolution in my life since nothing else was working out, So I decided to give it a try.   We agreed to meet there at eight, but I got there at seven, I didn't want to be late  and I wanted to get a feel of the place and make sure it met my expectations. As i walked in i knew i would like the place, nice decor dim lighting and live music. I proceeded to the bar and ordered a margarita and listened to the guitar man play someone Else's life with his fingers.  it was a really good margarita it actually had tequila in it. The bartender brought some complimentary chips and salsa and some bean dip. I didn't want to start eating since my date hadn't arrived yet, but one chip loaded with bean dip wouldn't hurt. After two bowls of chips and bean dip and three margaritas I decided to order an appetizer, Something light, so I ordered the seviche and let me tell you, it was the best seviche I have tried this far from the ocean, it couldn't be any fresher or tastier. It was soo good I decided to stick with the mariscos (seafood) and ordered the camarones borrachos, (like me)  Shrimp sauteed with garlic, spices and tequila, the perfect combination. You just can't go wrong with that, It was out of this world goodness!  All in all I had a wonderful time.  When you get caught between great food, a nice romantic ambiance and a guitar, you can't help  It but to fall in love. ....My date? Didn't make it.....But I fell in love nonetheless..... with the food at Viva Zapata's.                                                   PS.  Don't text and drive. You don't want to miss dinner!

I only ate three bites of my entree. Must have been terrible right?! Nope. It was the most glorious plate of Mexican goodness I've encountered in as long as I can reliably recall. The chili verde pork was perfection. The chile relleno bursting with flavor. The guacamole, out of this world.   It was the chorizo queso that did me in before I ever set eyes on my meal. A dish full of cheesy chorizo served with homemade tortillas made about 4 feet from our table.   Also, the best damn margarita I've ever had in my life. Did I mention the homemade tortillas?! Still fresh and warm.   Ask for Nohemi, she rocks!
Best Mexican food I've had in two years. I got the steak fajitas and my husband got the flautas with chicken. Chips are great. Tortillas are super fresh.

Not recommended. After eating 3/4 of the bowl of chips and dip we found a cherry stem. When we brought it to their attention the manager came over and accused us of putting it in there. You know how I rebuttable.  I will not eat there again and not recommend it.

Having lived in Southern CA and dining with my son's Mexican family for the past 7 years, I would rate Viva Zapatas as one of the best authentic Southwest Mexican restaurants in town.  I don't know what Texican food is like, but from Santa Fe west, this ranks top in my book.  And...they serve real micheladas!  If you haven't had one, try it!  I drive across town just for this food.

first off the service was okay. didn't feel welcome and the waiter was not too attentive considering it wasn't crowded at all.  the other staff made sure our chips and water was refilled.    salsa was okay and bean dip was pretty good.  they make homemade tortillas so it was interesting watching the lady make them.  the food was okay.  being from california and spoiled it definitely wasn't the best.  i probably won't be going back and will try to find another one here in las vegas to curb my authentic mexican cravings.
Good relax environment. Good mole. Worth the trip. Been here twice on separate occasions. One with happy hour. Good service, good food, and authentic music.

Five star Guacamole!!!  They prepare it so awsome right next to your table, fresh as can be... My daughter loves avacado , so if the kids are into it, it's a  winner no matter what... Theres a guy who plays his guitar  & it makes for great atmo...
An Ok Mexican Restaurant SLOW Service. Food not as authentic as hoped for.

Two words... Ensalada Marinera.  Two hollowed Avocado shells filled with Avocado, fresh salsa, Shrimp, Lettuce, Cheese, served a side of crackers lime and hot sauce.  I find this to be filling but not as overwhelming as a Coctel De Camarones.  (Shrimp Cocktail).    Also, they serve you chips and hot sauce AND refried beans... mmmm that's a first.  This is my first visit to this North Las Vegas Gem.  I was highly impressed with the food quality and service.     Please keep in mind that this review comes from a Mexican Native (from the state of Jalisco) so I you can rest assured I know a thing or two about Mexican cuisine. =P

Great place for the entire family. The menu, though only Mexican food, was broad enough to deliver satisfaction even to the picky eaters. I had a Carne Asada dish and  it was spectacular. The meat was tender and very well seasoned. the environment inside the restaurant was quite enjoyable. The decoration is very traditional and cultural. The service was impeccable as well. The food was delivered relatively promptly considering it is made to order. The dishes didn't seem rushed. Each dish was carefully and cleanly served. I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants an authentic Mexican taste.

Food was fine aside from all the fat & bones and minimal meat I received (I ordered birria). I had to ask for another drink and my husband didn't even get asked if he needed another drink... will probably not be coming back!

Primera y ultima vez q vengo, me recomendaron la campechana y q mala estaba, parece q estas comiendo pure de tomate con camaron... El servicio es muy bueno, aunq la comida tarda mucho en llegar a pesar de q no hay muchos clientes. Q decepcion no cuentan con rica comida mexicana

Good food, fresh tortillas! Busy on weekends, and a favorite of several military families I know from the nearby AFB. Great staff. The only weird thing is how dark it is. I had a hard time reading the menu and we had to pull out the phone flashlight. Other tables followed suit. It would be hard for someone to see who is visually impaired.

Holy authentic! I think my search for authentic Mexican food is officially over!   Their chips are super addicting, we ate two whole baskets. Comes with a side of the normal spicy and bean dip (mixture of both is amazing!)   I love the decor in this place with the colorful paper banners everywhere.   Got the usual Chile Verde (= lean pork stewed in green chile sauce) and it was extremely tasty and full of flavor.  Probably the best I've ever tasted, just because it really tasted like it had been marinated and then stewed in the chile verde. They brought it out piping hot with the normal sides of spanish rice and refried beans.  The el burro burrito was massive! Way bigger than an over-stuffed chipotle burrito, so for $9.99 you definitely get your money's worth.  Each of the meals came with Fideo which is like a pasta/tomato soup. I thought it was okay, not really for me. It was more like a watered down version of stringy spaghetti O's to me.   Service was awesome. The minute my glass of water went empty, they topped it off right away. They even pack your left over food at your table, so you're not left alone trying to pack it yourself.   I will def come back when I get a craving for some real good chile verde.

Since moving from Texas to Vegas, we have been craving good Mexican restaurant.  Unfortunately, Viva Zapatas didn't meet our expectations.  First, they got our to go order wrong. We ordered beef fajitas and they gave us chicken fajitas.  In addition, the chicken was over cooked and dry.   They also charge you extra for chips and salsa.  Their salsa has an odd smoky vinegar taste.  Lastly, the guacamole that comes with the other meal tasted like it came out of a can. The best part when we called to let them know about the mistake, they told us they do not offer beef fajitas???  Will not be returning.  We always count on Yelp for recommendations but this was a big fail.  Trying to figure out how they got so many good reviews.

This was my kind of place.  My family loved it.  I'll definitely be back because of the food, ambience, and wait staff.  I'm sorry to say that the only thing/person that sucked was the Hostess last night (04/21/2018) whom is the first person that is supposed to greet you and make you feel welcomed upon your arrival.    Not only was she not welcoming but she was straight out rude!  I don't know, maybe she was having a bad day because there's no way someone could be that rude in that position.

I've been here two times so far this year. Both times I was not disappointed. I'll share my most recent experience. Came today about lunch time. Promptly seated. Chips, beans, and ridiculously good salsa shop up at the table right after being seated. drink order taken immediately. Their staff worked together to keep us happy. Our drinks never saw the bottom of the cup. I appreciated that because there's nothing more annoying than the wait staff letting your cup sit empty while your trying to wash down your meal.   I had the carnitas fajitas with corn tortilla. These were THE BEST carnitas I have had in my life this far. Incredible flavor! My bf had shredded beef tacos with the crunch shell. He really enjoyed it.   They also have a little station in the corner of the restaurant where they have a lady making fresh flour and corn tortillas. I haven't tried the flour so I can't comment on those. But the corn tortillas are amazing too. The best.   I look forward to visiting this place again.
I go at least once a week, the food is always good and the staff always friendly. Parking can sometimes be a pain but the staff and food make up for that.
Top notch!! Everything on the menu is amazing and they make homemade tortillas like in Mexico in the corner of the restaurant. The design of the place is unique and very awesome to look at.

Just like the reviews, they have a live Mexican music here. Service at bar was quick. Good bean dip, good salsa and good chips. Maybe it's because I came on a week day, but it was not busy here today which was good for me and the rest of the customers. I ordered the fish tacos deep fried and they wee delicious. I will come back here again and try the other dishes.
I got the carne Asada plate I believe and it was way too bland for me. But if you add salt and pepper it was a lot better!

Ambiance: ¬†The restaurant is in the east side of Vegas , on Craig. The decor reminds of old Mexico implying the food is authentic. Since its Halloween, the decor was based on their dia de muerte festival.   Service: Service was wonderful, the waiters knew the food well and gave me good recommendations based on the preferred protein that I wanted. The waiter was attentive to our needs.  Food: Food was great, the complimentary nachos with the salsa and refried beans were really good. Expect to keep on munching on the nachos while waiting for the entrees. The salsa had a good roasted tomato taste with spice that keeps you eating the nachos! The entree that I had was grilled chicken and it tasted great. Plus the freshly made flour tortillas made the dining experience better.  Overall: I would definitely come back to try the other entrees, dining experience is great and the quality of the food is very good , the nachos is a definite bonus. Next time I want to try this restaurant for dinner with the family this time.

Food and drinks were great. Server was very courteous. The only issue we has is that one of our left over plates was taken to be boxed up but it never was. The server took it and tossed it. He was very apologetic but it was not right. If it was any inexpensive food it would have been ok but it was shrimp!!

One of the best dine in Mexican restaurants where the food is actually good. I've been here plenty of times and ordered different dishes. This time I had the steak cilantro which is bomb!!! The green salsa is really good! I ordered it medium rare and it was perfect! Super soft and flavorful. The tortillas are hand made on the spot! Also I'd recommend the "gordito de camaron" from the appetizers. Pretty much a burrito cut in 3 with shrimp and tons of melted cheese. Other dishes I've had are filete relleno and the bacon wrapped shrimp. All good! The service is on point. Only thing would be the parking. Limited very crammed space. Other than that, no complaints!!

Took forever to take our order.   Even longer to get our food. They do not have queso dip. Probably because this place is very authentic.   Not a big deal to me but my boys said this place is off the list.

well i used to enjoy the food but every time my wife and i visit this restaurant it gets worse and worse and i dont want to risk how bad the next visit will be....well the main problem i had was a mexican restaurant put canned jalapenos on the nachos and had ballpark cheese......gross

My husband took me here for Mother's Day. the wait staff & support was amazing. I had Sangria which was amazing , taco, tostada, & chicken enchlida which were all amazing.I have been looking for a great Mexican Restaurant & this far surpassed my expectations. this place is amazing. also, try the bean dips.....delicious!

If you are looking for the every day menu items of Chilis or the like,  this isn't the place for you.  But, if you are looking for a small restaurant that serves authentic Mexican dishes ... this place is a "Must"!  Are they sitting you in 5 minutes? No.  Do you get your drink or meal within 2 minutes of ordering? No.  Are you in a rush and looking for something prepared by a line cook? Then don't go here.  This is a medium sized restaurant with great atmosphere (there was a live entertainer when we were there). Sit at the bar or a table... Both are perfect! We started with the fresh guacamole.  My Hubs had the Burria de Chivo and I finally decided on the Pollo de Conac. Everything was delicious! The service was good (yes, a little slow... but we were not putting out any fires....) and the wait staff was friendly.  Would definitely return to this spot! Great job!
Love This Place.. Food Is Excellent n Service Is Great.. i Dont Have a Bad Thing To Say About This Place.. Waiter's Alex and Jose Were The Bomb.. I Highly Recommend This Place..

I was so glad to stumble on to this place!  This Mexican Eatery has been here for about 16 years, so not sure how we did not know of this place.  As soon as you park your car you can already sniff out some wonderful aromas.    Upon entering you are greeted and your eyes will immediately start admiring some of the Mexican Revolution pieces placed throughout the restaurant.  Totally transports you to that era.  Just awesome! There are also 2 ladies making fresh tortillas.    We were seated and immediately greeted with some chips accompanied by salsa and warm refried beans.   The salsa was not great but the beans were very tasty. I knew I wanted to try their Menudo but I am always hesitant to try Menudo anywhere but home since it can be horribly executed at times. But I took my chances and I was so glad I did.  It was delicious and came with fresh made corn and flour tortillas and all the little condiments that make this dish alone something I would come back for.  The bowl is very big and I definitely took some home. It may seem a little steep at $12 but it really is a meal all on its own.  I also sampled some of my husband's combo which consisted of a beef tamale, enchilada, chile relleno with beans and rice and a side order of an asada taco.   The tamale had good flavor but was a little on the dense side, the enchilada was very tasty as well as the chile relleno but the taco was horrible, beans and rice were nice.   For dessert we were recommended their Fried Ice Cream, I am not usually a fan of if anywhere else but we opted to try especially since they were sold out of their flan. It was actually really good but I would not call it Fried Ice Cream, it was more like a round ball of vanilla ice cream coated with some cinnamon toast crunch and coconut flakes.  Still was very tasty.   Service was excellent and overall very nice place I will definitely try this place again and maybe try some their amazing looking drinks we saw leaving their bar to accompany my Menudo. Salud!
Such a cute, quaint atmosphere! Great food! My boyfriend & I tend to over order in case we don't like something. Everything was terrific! We are oh so stuffed & will definitely recommend to friends.

we have been coming here for years.  we bring our children and they love the live music.  the service is always good.  i will warn you, it is easy to fill up on chips, salsa, and beans before the food comes.
Yummmmm. Love their salsa and food. Always our go to place in Vegas for Mexican food. Haven't found any place that's better out here.

This was my first visit as I've heard great things about this being one of the few great places to eat Mexican food and I wasn't disappointed.  One thing I always find that's a hallmark of a great restaurant is great service from being greeted at the door to when you sit down and how you're attended during your meal and Viva Zapata was all those things and attentive to my drink, chips, salsa, and bean dip.  I just want to mention that bean dip with chips is something few places offer but always wins me over in a Mexican restaurant.   I ordered the Torta de Pierna which is a pork sandwich that came out with some time that shows it wasn't just heated up and made with care.  The bread was perfectly toasted and the meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful.   I didn't feel a hot plate nor was warned about one and that's something that always makes me feel great before a bite.    I'm looking forward to future visits and trying more plates from this place due to the food, service, and overall atmosphere.
Great place for lunch. We ordered the guacamole and it was fabulous! Prepared at the table with all the fixings! Food was wonderful and staff was great! Jesus took good care of us!

I would not recommend this place for a birthday celebration. I told the waiter several times it was my sister birthday and they were supposed to sing for her and they didnt. The food was good it just took a bit for the food to come out.
Amazing mexican joint with homemade goodies. Had the fresh guacamole and the Menudo soup... wow just awesome great find near the LV office.

Since I have to eat healthier, we've been careful of the places we've been picking (Especially when we're on the road). I have been coming here for years and I have to APOLOGIZE, I haven't mention this eatery until now. The staff here has always been friendly and bring you chips and two stone bowls with salsa as soon as you're seated.  One is a warm bean dip which is creamy and warm and the other is a finely ground tomato based salsa.  Viva Zapatas do have healthier dishes on their menu, but they are not "flagged" as such.  My favorite dish here is named after the owner's Grandmother, so you know it has to be good and it's on the healthy side.  It is called, Pollo Estilo "Abuelita Magdalena", which is two Grilled Chicken breast simmered in olive oil, fresh lime juice, garlic, oregano and yellow peppers.  The chicken is flavorful and kept moist from the cooking process.  The plate is also shared with rice, guacamole and beans.  Every time we have to go to Nellis Air Force base/North Las Vegas, we always stop by Zapatas for a meal (my wife says the Margarita's are good, too)!
Consistently amazing service and food. Table side guacamole, delicious shrimp dishes and 5 star service. And the homemade tortillas to die for. Jesus was our excellent waiter.

Authentic, flavorful and delicious. I love that they have items on their menu that you can't find in most Mexican restaurants. I also loved the handmade flour tortillas. I believe every entree comes with a side of soup, which I really enjoyed. My friend ordered one of the carne asada plates. The one broiled in lemon juice and spices... sooo good. I had the shrimp that was cooked with a mayonnaise-based sauce. It's good if you like mayo lol! Very different but definitely good. Oh and Did I mention fee chips, salsa, and bean dip? All of which tasted really good. Lastly, the ambience inside has a certain charm and warmth, which is inviting. I'll be coming back here time and time again.

Real Mexican authentic food. (Trust me I know I'm Mexican and cook it all the time) first of all the customer service is wonderful. I can see why they are always busy. (I drive all the way from summerlin just to eat here) I love the atmosphere and feel like I'm at my tias house in Mexico or something. The chips, salsa and beans are always fresh and they are free. Their on tap beers and Margaritas are always top shelf and super fresh. You get free soupa too. The food is hot and very reasonable pricing. Love it here. Like I said I drive all the way from summerlin just to eat here. Oh yea, there is always live music as well.

EXCELLENT food and AMAZING service. Our waitress was extremely friendly and thoughful throughout the whole meal. And the Margaritas are also extremely good. We managed to get there just in time for their 2 for 1 happy hour deal. Love this place and will come again.
Yum! We went here for my boyfriends birthday! and the food was amazing. They even sang him happy birthday with live guitar and it really felt like a FIESTA!

Tried this place the other day and had the green Chili and pork burrito combo (Uno on the lunch specials).  The portion was a good size and it is served with rice and beans.  They also serve chips with bean dip and salsa while you wait for your order.  This is going to be my go to Mexican restaurant in town.

Yum. Yum. Yum. Talk about delicious food. Even my mom who 1. Hates food 2. Likes chicken mole 3. Is a Texan so lives off Mexican food, fell in love with this place. She said she hasn't found Mol√© that tasted that good since the 70s. The food is always fresh and timely. The staff makes you feel important and the chips and dips are mind blowing. Fresh tortillas are bomb. Atmospheres and love music is fantastic and everything Ive tried more than suites my fancy. Will be coming back for years to come.

Their 25 minute wait turned out to be an hour and 20 minute wait. We come here often and love the food and especially the margaritas but tonite is just ridiculous.   Sorry Zapatas I'm not sure if we'll be back.  And did I mention that the margarita was very weak?  I think the bartender forgot the tequila.  *sigh*
Love this place!! Not too pricey and so much food. Tacos are amazing and they make the guacamole in front of you.

I had the opportunity to come to this restaurant on a weekend trip in Vegas. While in North Vegas I searched for good Mexican food and saw the amount of reviews in the amount of stars at this restaurant had received. I can honestly tell you that it may have been low in regards to star quantity! This Mexican restaurant was absolutely amazing and the staff is great but I think the most impressive part of this restaurant is how clean it was. If you ever find yourself near this restaurant you owe it to yourself, considering the prices, to come in and experience it for yourself!

Ordered chilaquiles with steak and she ordered a steak lunch. The salsa was ok, but the guacamole was the best you have to come and try their guacamole. We sat right by the tortilla lady so that was cool we got to see her do work. Clapping it up lol which made me feel like I was at home. The tequila shots were good and the service was ok. I definitely would come back to experience more of this gem.

I love this place!! I have been going here for years and years and just haven't gotten around to post a review.  The fideo soup, the homemade chips and salsa, the steak, the burritos, tacos... Anything I have ever had is DELISH.  Very nice bar area as well as dine in area for kids.  Sometimes there is a live mariachi man playing as well.  Great place to go for big family dinners, or on a date :-) Love it ask for the chips and salsa at the table and they are free!
I've had my share of good Mexican food but this place hands down great food great atmosphere great service I will be coming back

We come here once a month or so and are never disappointed. Service is good and employees are friendly. Ordered the shrimp quesadilla for an appetizer and it was delicious. Cobb salad for dinner. Another delicious meal!

this place was awesome! First trip there yesterday will definitely go back. The entire staff, from the hostess at the front, to the servers and bussers, everyone was super friendly and made sure we were enjoying our meal. The tortillas are so fresh, u can see them being made in house at the back of the restaurant.  Also had live music. I order the Enchiladas de Mole (sp?) and hubby got fajitas. At first the prices seemed a little high, but when the food came out we found out why. The portions were large and the food was excellent. My enchiladas were just cheese but the mole sauce was delicious. Came with grilled chicken on top, side of rice & beans and yummy soup. Hubby fajita meat was seasoned well.
