Only came with 2 tortillas to rap but when he asked for more, they came out hot and fresh.  Only downside to this place is the parking. It's behind a gas station so the parking is very limited.

This place was great. I had the chicken enchilada lunch special and my daughter had the beef and bean burritos special. The value fit the cost and the atmosphere was comforting. We will definitely be going back, hopefully soon, with a larger party.

Location is bad at bad neighborhood but the food and atmosphere is wonderful. I visit as family dinner, their fideo soup is the best in town, their music at the location by real musician is real good. Proper dimmed light with nice Mexican atmosphere. Some dinner time we have to wait 10-15 min, but now we know better time without wait.   We always get combo menus, my option is set with Relleno and Cheese Enchilada. 1 out of 10 comes with super seedy-Relleno, but 9 out of 10 comes proper sized pepper with full of cheese. Whenever we want Cheesy night with beautiful crisp chips and Fideo soup, we drive 30 min and go and eat. The best in town after 7 years of trying most of Mexican Restaurant

We stopped in after going to the speedway and we were starved. This cute little restaurant was just perfect for our hungry tummies! We ordered the beef flautas and the shrimp fajitas and they were brought out sizzling and tasted great! Service was good and fast. Well worth it. Chips and salsa were yummy too!

We stumbled upon this hidden gem spending the night in NLV passing through town. The menu has a ton of offerings and made it difficult to narrow down what to order.  The chips with bean dip and salsa were a first and really good too! Drink specials including beer and cocktails made with their house tequila were great.  I ordered the Carne Asada "Villa" and have to say it was the best I've had. Keep in mind I've ordered this plate all over LA, OC and SD and none compare to Viva Zapatas. The steak was seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection!   If you're in NLV, do yourself a favor and eat here!

Large menu selection! There's a veggie section, huevos, chicken, shrimp, other parts of animals I'd rather not eat. Pretty hard not to find something you want.   FOOD Complimentary Chips and salsa (3.5 stars): Come with a bean dip and a salsa dip. I liked the bean dip more.   Soup that comes with meal (3 stars): Pretty good actually. Noodles inside were good. Broth is like a tomato chicken broth.    Guacamole (3.5 stars): Good guac but I've had better.    Shrimp fajitas (3 stars): Shrimp were way overcooked, pretty chewy. Rice and beans were good. They have hand made tortillas, which were okay. I used to live in SD where there are tons of Mexican restaurants that do hand made tortillas and they taste so much better.   Complimentary Birthday Churros (2 stars): Not very soft. Caramel sauce wasn't so great with it either. Nice of them to give something for birthdays though! But these churros are on the regular dessert menu also, wouldn't recommend them. They also sing to you and put a sombrero on you for your birthday.   SERVICE (5 stars):  Our server was awesome. On top of everything we asked for. Waters were always getting filled. And once we told him there were vegetarians in the group he made sure to tell them what they could and couldn't eat.   ATMOSPHERE (3.5 stars): Place isn't that big but it's a good size, make reservations if u can, it was packed when we go there but we had reservations.    PARKING: Parking is tight. The lot is weird so it takes a while to get in some of the spots.   Overall if you need to go to some kind of restaurant around this area it works. But nothing spectacular. If you have a big group they do a good job with service.

Authentic Mexican food 100. Try the shrimp juice margarita to die for. Ate a mocateje bowl with friends and had to agree it was the best. Everything is fresh and tasty, not tasteless. Highly recommend and not pricey. The restaurant is not big inside and the later you go you might wait a bit. The wait is worth the great food.

The food is excellent here. I love the beans and salsa they bring to the table. I've had several dishes and have never been unhappy worth any of them.  It's a little but pricey, but you get a lot for your money.   I loved the live music when we were there last.  I've always had great servers that offer suggestions and are accommodating.

What a great restaurant, fresh tortillas being made daily. This place has a good menu for seafood that makes it a great spot to visit. Prices for dinner are good, but you have to check out their lunch menu, incredible deal. Overall, the best part is the waiters in the restaurant, incredible service and you can bet on never having to wait for drink refills.

First time at this establishment, I was very pleased with the service and the food. I came into town for work and met up with some old friends who brought me here for dinner on Sunday night. The place was very busy but we were seated promptly upon arrival. Chips and salsa were brought to the table immediately after we were seated and the waiter came very soon after to take our drink order. The drinks came out quickly and were very cold. I ordered the Carne la Tampiquena and the New York strip was absolutely delicious! Cooked to perfection and as good or better than most steak houses I've ever been to. We also had fresh guacamole made tableside for us and it was very fresh and delicious. Three dinners and four beers for only 82 bucks? almost unbelievable. We were thank graciously by our host upon our departure. Keep up the good work! I will come here again when I visit Vegas next time.

I like the food here, sometimes the service lags a bit.  The parking is rough.  The menu is very extensive and make a choice quite difficult.  The locations is far, but worth it.  I love the avocado shrimp salad, very fresh.  They prepare guacamole at your table and it's good.  There is a lot to explore on this menu.  As mentioned before the chips and tortillas are fresh.  I'm looking forward to trying their cactus appetizer.  When you are leaving don't forget to get a mint, yum.  I pondered over what they were and finally asked.  Key lime after dinner mints.

We've been coming here for years and something was just off this last visit. We arrived at 5pm on a Tuesday expecting a large dinner crowd and the place was empty and we were wondering why. The food was good like normal but it literally took 30 minutes for it to arrive at the table from the time we actually ordered. The place was empty but the service was horrible. And then to top it off the waiter hit my 3 year old son on the head with a water glass that he was refilling. Not a bump but an actual thump that we all heard.

Food is amazing! Huevos rancheros are to die for! Mini sopes are real good also. Carne asada in them is so tasty. They start you with fideo soup. Which like noodle soup the Mexican version. We have been coming in the morning so not sure if they serve the soup all day. Honestly food here in las Vegas is amazing. So many hidden treasures. This is one of them. Moved from San Diego. California they aren't very many good authentic Mexican places. Not pricey either.

This was a great place to stop for lunch on the way to Utah from L.A.  It's just outside of all the traffic and hubbub of the city and it's got a huge selection of traditional Mexican comfort foods.  They make their own tortillas, which is always a plus.  The restaurant and bathrooms are clean and there is plenty of parking (at least, there was when I came for lunch).  A little more expensive than I had expected, but the food was good and the service was quick.

After a little over an hour stuffing snacks into plastic bags under Three Square's Backpacks program, my coworkers and I headed down the street to Viva Zapatas. Even though we showed up about 45 minutes early for our reservation, they already had our table ready and were happy to seat us!  The awesome staff never let our drinks get less than half full, which meant a lot of running around for them that did not go unappreciated. They brought out all ten of our orders at once, hot but not so hot that we couldn't dig in immediately. The salsa is fabulous here--it's hotter than most restaurants I've been to, and peppery to boot! LOTS of choices on the menu, plus a whole bunch of lunch specials.  The only downside I can think of is their squishy, uneven parking lot, but my boss managed to navigate it in his pick-up, so I guess it's not an issue.  Service is great, food is great, bathrooms are clean (check out the sinks!) Absolutely will be back next time I volunteer at Three Square. :)

Cognac Steak was missing the flavor of this steak dish and we were highly disappointed. The Cocktail Camarones was really good and you can't go wrong with their excellent chips and dip. Overall it was hit and miss tonight.
Excellent food, very nice staff and beautiful live music. Very clean with a warm, cozy atmosphere. If this place were closer to my house, it would be my destination every time we go out to eat.

Horrible! Came here ONLY because of reviews...waited over 2 HOURS just to get our food! Not only that but they brought out the plates individually! By the time our whole parties food came out it was COLD! Mgmt was HORRIBLE, they literally argued with us regarding the cold food! Worst experience ever! Will NEVER, EVERRRR come here again!
So delicious  yummy margaritas and soup and bean dip ! Ordered chill Colorado to be continued!
Still the best!! Delicious food, bomb drinks, great service. What else can u ask for. Must try!!

This restaurant is conveniently down the street from Nellis Air Force Base, and although I wouldn't call it perfect mexican, the food was delicious. I had the carne asada and highly recommend it. It was tender, juicy, and cooked just right. The staff was really friendly but it seemed like they were shorthanded and it was fairly busy. All in all I'd definitely go back for the carne asada, however I wouldnt call it one of my top 5.

I was really excited to try this place because my friends had told me how good it was. We got our chips, salsa and beans in a decent time. The salsa was WAY too salty and the beans tasted like shrimp. It took forever for a waiter to take our order. To the point where my friend had to go get someone. Once we finally got our order in we waited about 30 mins for our food. Our food had no tatse. We were there a total of 2 hours. You also have to pay for refills which we didnt know because the menu said nothing about it. My husband and I ended up spending $60. If we knew that we would be spending that kind of money it definitely wouldn't have been here.
The tamale was amazing, as was the large house margarita. The best part was the excellent and kind service!

Mexican food is a love it or hate it outcome.  You have no choice but to LOVE absolutely everything about this place. Staff and service are excellence, very nice, polite, fast, just amazing! Everything we have ordered here has been so delicious! The guacamole is made in front of you and the chips and salsa also come with a bean dip that is great and I don't even like beans! The live music is fun and entertaining and not overwhelming. They have fresh homemade lemonade that is so refreshing. So clean and well taken care of. This place would get 6 stars if it was an option!

Amazing food! No parking. There are literally less than 20 spots. We parked at the gas station next door. The wait was fast for a holiday. Service was a bit slow, they forgot one of our drinks. But what they lack in service, they make up in food!! Fresh tortilla makers behind a glass wall. Nice music. Great chips and salsa. Small place but my goodness worth coming back again for.
Excellent food! There was someone playing the guitar which really brought it home for me. Definitely my new favorite Mexican restaurant.

Good solid Mexican food.  a great lunch choice.  the lunch selection is on the back of the menu and its pretty good.  I get the number 6  I just bumped it up a star because another place i went too is so bad.

Whenever my husband is craving Mexican food, we head over to Viva Zapatas!  They are just as good as Lindo (if not better), but without the super high price.  The food is always great and they keep the homemade chips and salsa/bean dip coming.  If you order guac, they make it right at the table.  They usually offer a complimentary cup of soup as well.  What I really love about Zapatas is that they always accommodate my picky food needs and never make me feel badly about it.  The service is top notch!  They also have one of the best margaritas in Vegas!  They have a great happy hour from 2p.m.-6:00 p.m. (I think) M-F with 2 for 1 drinks - you can't beat it!  I love the live music every night and since they are located so close to the Galaxy Theater in the Cannery, it's the perfect date night restaurant too!  The restaurant is a bit hard to find since they are in the same lot as a gas station (if you are coming off of the Craig Rd. exit on 95 - turn towards Pecos Road and you can't miss it) but I promise, it's worth it!  Zapatas is definitely an Eastside hidden gem!

Food was amazing. Even though people thought it was pricey I had bacon wrapped shrimp $18 but it came with 8 shrimp well worth the money. The only bad thing is they don't have elote or I would never need to go anywhere else

I used to love this joint, and don't get me wrong but the food is not quite as good as it used to be.  This all started about 1 year ago.  For example, the sopa de fideos does not have the noodles it used to have, and the overall flavor is not like it once was.  The dishes used to have a lot more zest, now they are just a little bland.  Still great food, but just not as good as it once was unfortunately.    Still very clean and great service by the staff.

This was a recommendation from a person we met at another restaurant and man it was amazing. The food was so good and the staff was so kind. Felt like a family atmosphere. Will for sure be coming back.

I've heard about this place from my friends an my god this place is amazing from customer service to quality and quantity! This was my first time here with my brother... Most definitely I will be back with my kids they'd love this place.... AMAZING STAFF by the way smiling an happy to work THANK YOU VIVA ZAPATA'S you made my day much better

came here a couple weeks ago with my fianc√©, we got sat down right away (we beat the dinner rush) started us with happy hour - margaritas and the best bean dip and salsa. of course we killed right through those chips. he ordered the shrimp tacos and I ordered my favorite dish, chicken enchiladas with mole soooooo good! good ambience and great service, definitely will remember this place the next Time we go out for Mexican food.

I'm always looking for a good mole. I decided to switch the standards enchilada sauce for the home made mole (extra $2.00 charge) but was disappointed. The vegetarian enchiladas were not something to write home about. Normally the sauce, tortilla and the filling (steamed vegetables) come together over all I would not order this dish again. I've had much better vegetarian enchiladas in other restaurant. This plate was not cheap I was disappointed. The beans had a good home made taste but the Spanish rice was not properly cooked hard texture. The staff was really kind in celebrating in singing at my daughters birthday dinner. Thank you.

Camarones Sarandeados Estilo "Cuautla" oh what a dish! Although we have gone here several times this has to be my all time favorite! I tried this dish for the first time today and I was quite taken by surprise. When I saw the ingredients and it said, with a "touch of mayonnaise", I thought what could go wrong with mayonnaise? It was absolutely delicious!!! I love their sopa Fideo that they serve before your entree, it's like a little bowl of Mexican noodle soup, I cheat and crunch up some of my chips they give you with the bean dip, I love this place. The service is excellent, the food is delicious and I wish I lived closer. I rate this place 10 stars!!!!!!!

Dried out, no flavor. Got carne asada tacos for lunch on a Monday around noon. The free chips and salsa are great, but the carne asada tacos I ordered were just chunks on meat in a warm tortilla. There was no seasoning and the meat was tough. There was supposed to be Pico de gallo  on top which turnout out to be 2 small flakes of tomato. No good.

Been in Las Vegas since 09' and my wife's coworkers drove from the base to check it out. She was pleased so I decided we would try it out together. The chips were nice and hot also very fresh. Bean dip is superb. The salsa they use is.....different. I like chunky salsa and spicy. This salsa isn't. But there food is good and always good portions. Glad to know this place is here.  I'll go back again!
Slow service. I thought the food was kind of tasteless. I had to smother it in salsa to taste anything good.
Fideo soup is pretty good.  Their Carne Asada tacos are good along with their chips and salsa.  A bit over prices but it's worth it once in a while.  No fatty pieces of beef with the tacos.

Best Mexican food in las vegas. Cool atmosphere, good prices, great food and cold beer. Chips, salsa and bean dip all you can eat. Tortillas are made fresh. Its a small place so always make sure to make a reservation.

Visited this place for the first time the other day. They have a great happy hour, it was buy one get on free drinks so my guest and i ordered a margarita and the waiter brought out 4. It was hard NOT to drink them since they were already on the table. Pretty thoughtful, since it started getting real busy after 6pm. I ordered the Cognac steak with the mushroom sauce, it was sooo good! Next time i want to try the Coca Cola steak, it sparked my curiosity.
Really nice ambiance and decent food. Fun, live singer. Staff is really quick and observant. Delicious flan!
Good food and very nice Servers.  Fresh hand made Tortilla's.  only one downfall...HUGE bar taking up most of the room.  Small dining area.  Other than that....GREAT

Really good Mexican restaurant!  The Good: The service was impeccable, unlike any Mexican restaurant Ive seen in the valley. The drinks were always refilled, the food was tasty and the servers were professional and polite, and tentative. The decor is awesome I couldnt stop looking around at all the cool shit they have on the walls. but it didnt seem that tacky.   The Bad: Nothing was really bad here. the Hostess was a little bland but Ive come to accept that from the valley and the food wasnt that great and it def isnt that cheap. I still dont understand how they do their pricing.    The Ugly: I would say the only ugly thing is the location. This restaurant has very little parking and it is out of the way in North Las Vegas, but im glad it exists.

Being from a Puerto Rican and Mexican family, I enjoy authentic Mexican food. Food here is great. Large menu with many choices and combo plates. Servers are quick to bring refills on chips, salsa, or drinks. My first time here was at dinner time and aside from the lighting not being that great, everything else was perfect. I felt just like family and welcomed by everyone working there. Being from CA, I have had many different types of Mexican food from numerous places. This place is definitely a go to when I'm craving Mexican food.  Only downfall in my opinion, which is why I did not give them 5 stars, is because of their parking lot situation. Very few spots to park in. Luckily my first time here it wasn't too busy. But the second time I came here, there were no spots and nearly had to battle someone else for an open spot when someone left.  Definitely will be back again.

Two adults and a one-year-old looking for somewhere new (to us), found Viva Zapata's. We were there for late breakfast/early lunch. Seated promptly! The hostess took the drink orders and the waitress brought the drinks and a busser brought chips, salsa, and bean dip. Awesome teamwork! Everyone's timing was on point.  Allow me to point out: if you're craving chips and salsa, you can go to pretty much any old Mexican restaurant and get your fix. Viva Zapata's offers chips, salsa, bean dip, AND a fabulous fideo soup (it's basically tomato soup with short noodles; VZ's take on it is among the best I've had). Speaking of the soup, the busser brought out a cup of it for the toddler before our orders were even taken, which kept her busy and gave us time to look over the menu.  He had huevos rancheros and I had camarones deseados(?). Huevos rancheros came with pork (a little dry, but great flavor). Shrimp was incredible. Something different about their rice--I can't quite put my finger on it, but it's definitely a good thing.

Well we waited forever to be seated and then to be served...cognac chicken was divine...my daughter ordered that...so was the bean dip as other viewers have said...live music excellent as well...Stevie wonder in Spanish is a treat.  But my pork was off...not a little..a LOT...as in rancid spit it in the napkin felt like puking all night off.  So beware...
So good! Service was amazing, food was excellent. Hand made tortillas.... Yum. 5 stars all the way.

Me and my wife come here all the time for some good mexican food! They are like the fine dining of mexican food. The avocado appetizer is the best I've ever had at any mexican restaurant. Part of the reason its so good is the experience; they actually make the appetizer in front of you! Another good feature of this place is the live music. Theres an amazing guitar player/singer who sings a lot of classical mexican tunes. The reason I gave this a 4 out of 5 is due to the small and inconvenient parking lot, especially since they're usually always busy. Second, the last time we went there we were COMPLETELY ignored. We had to find the manager twice in order get our food ordered and delivered. 30 minute wait is unacceptable, especially when no one checks on you. That is what cost them a perfect score. Other than that, a very good meal awaits for you here.

This was some of the best Mexican food in Vegas!!! The salsa's were awesome, all 3 of them!!! I went there on a Saturday, busy but was seated fast!!! luckily~ The lowrider car club "LAS VEGAS" cc decided to end there cruise there as well so the whole parking lot filled up with old bombs!!!! and cool cars. The margarita was a fish bowl~ and the plate I had shredded beef tacos Was excellent... over all service was excellent,food and decor was a 4 star night****!!!!

Great Mexican food! And the handmade corn and flour tortillas! Always a good choice! I've been going to this place for over 10 years and I always have a good time and leave stuff! Great staff and customer service! A definitely go to spot..

Ate dinner here tonight. Sorry that we didn't take any pictures of our meals. The food and drinks were delicious. Especially the Queso Condido con Chorizo. Our server Ramon was excellent, and so was Osmani. Will definitely be returning.  Good service, good food, good drinks = A GOOD TIME !!!

Food is decent but orders are incredibly slow. I placed a Togo order and it took them 40 min when then told me it would be 15-20 on the phone.  Also, they tried to charge me for the free drink that comes with the lunch special. Then they told me if you order to go then drinks aren't included and wouldn't give me the drinks. They don't state this anywhere on their menu! That's called false advertising.

Amazing service, table side Guacamole, home made tortillas that they recommend you eat butter with and are amazing, live music, waitress was so accommodating and nice especially since we looked a little bedraggled coming directly from the water slides. WOW!
we have been coming to this fantastic place for more than 15 years..  they make the best  tamarindo and mescal margarita!! yum yum yum. hats off to lorenzo(manager) food is phenomenal.

I love new experiences and was able to try some chipolte lengua (tongue). I was surprised at how mellow a texture the tongue was, but I definitely enjoyed it, though I would have liked to have tried a different sauce that it was cooked in. The waiter was very friendly, the hostess was cute, and the accompanying conversation from the table next to mine about some outlandish feat made for a good dining experience.

My family loves this restaurant!  My husband orders enchilada dishes,  i explore the seafood menu.  We have never been disappointed.  The food is consistently great.  The service is great as well. My kids,  who are normally very finicky  with Mexican food,  go crazy for the food here. Atmosphere is amazing, due to the decor,  live music,  and cleanliness. Only issue is that our  family of five is sat in a booth made for four.
Great food great service always busy.  Tortilla lady is the cherry on top for a great Mexican restaurant

Order the Prepriado! Micheladas are my favorite and they're delicious here!!  Foods always amazing!!  The lunch specials is a great deal about $10!  M-F 11-3. $4 tostada fills me up!!  Love love that they serve beans with fresh made chips and salsa!!  This is my toddlers lunch!!  The steak fajitas are a favorite!!  The seasoning is so flavorful and makes the onions and peppers super tasty!!  I've ordered them mixed but I prefer the steak!!  Service is always great and the food comes out in no time!

We just happened to stumble across this place and I'm glad we did! We usually go to Leticias for awesome Mexican food but we didn't want to drive that far so when we came across Viva Zapatas, of course we had to try it out! The food is great, atmosphere is beautiful, and the staff is friendly. We will definitely be returning!

First of all, I live in Henderson and come to this place when I am craving authentic Mexican food. In other words, I travel about 30 minutes and pass a lot of restaurants along the way. I have tried a few dishes that have been really good, but I think I have a favorite- the pork marinated in Coca-Cola. The pork is tender (not fatty), and is covered in a sauce that will make you slap your momma. Oh, did I mention there is a lady in the back making homemade tortillas? Please remember to tip this nice lady -- she is working hard back there. The staff is friendly and attentive , and there is a good chance you will catch live music while enjoying the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.

It's okay here.   The waitstaff was great, the menu is really big... but I'm on a quest for Texmex and yet again, haven't found it.  If you need some mexican food near the base, here's your place. I wouldn't make a trip from anywhere in the valley to come here though.

I could sit and eat the bean dip and table side guac all day. It's excellent. You could do it too, because the service is OUTSTANDING!   But we can't all survive on chips, so I order more food to satisfy my inner fat-kid. I haven't had anything that I haven't thoroughly enjoyed, but I am a huge fan of the fajitas...and those oh-so-good fresh tortillas.   Bring a wheel barrow. They may just roll you out for free.

The hubs and I were there for dinner last night and it was amazing! The service was impeccable, the were very attentive to us, even thought there were some large parties seated near us. The servers were not wandering aimlessly throughout the restaurant, they were on a mission to please the customers and make sure that they felt as though they were the only guest in the house! Jose, our waiter was excellent, his other server-bus was literally running throughout the tables cleaning up, serving chips, and checking on tables...Our food came out in a timely manner and was excellent! The homemade flour tortillas are outstanding and the manager inquired as to how our meal was @the end of dinner and was genuine about it! It is close to nellis afb which was perfect! We may have to go back for cinco de mayo!

The carne asada dish. OMG!  We showed up at 4pm and lunch menu was still in effect and so was happy hour (2 x 1 margaritas).  They bring out salsa and refried beans with chips, which is a nice change.  Like I mentioned before, I ordered the carne asada plate off of the lunch menu and the steak was a slice of New York steak.  I ordered it medium and it was so tender, juicy and flavorful.  And with freshly made tortillas.  The margaritas were ok, nothing out of the ordinary but the steak is what made this place so memorable.

I was really excited to come here, especially because they have guac!!! I've heard many positive things about the restaurant so I decided to give it a try. We were greeted by a friendly host and sat in a booth as requested. It wasn't too busy so I expected things to go smoothly, but I was wrong. Server came to get our drink order and they came fast but from there on everything went down hill. We ordered guacamole and it took about 15 mins before the server came and made it table side. After that we put in our entree order and that took about 40 minutes. By the time our food came we were full from the chips, guac, salsa, and beans but we still managed to share my chicken sopitos (they were soooooo good). Unfortunately because the food took so long we weren't able to eat our torta. I asked for the manager because we were unhappy with how our experience had gone so far. He apologized but it didn't seem sincere, he was actually making excuses of why it took so long(a torta does NOT take 40 minutes to make). I mean, I've worked in the restaurant industry and if someone's food ever took long I would apologize and find a way to make it better(no we weren't fishing for free food, we paid for what we consumed). All in all the food was good but it took way too long, not sure I'll be back.
Love the food, the quality and the experience, not to mention the staff are so attentive!

The good thing? The food is delicious. The bad thing? Waiter doesn't speak nor understand English very much! It was easier to point out what I wanted then speak to him. Ummm, this is America, people, learn the language! Great atmosphere with someone singing and playing the keyboard. The servers were attentive to our needs but it felt like overkill being watched as I ate. As soon as I put down my bowl, someone was ready to take it away. The tables are a bit small to place all our food and drinks on and it took forever to get our bill. I don't know if we will be back.
Authentic flavor, great customer service, quick to bring out your food, friendly, attentive and always make Birthday surprises fun. Favorite Mexican restaurant in town!

Zapatas a local favorite of many but didn't quite live up to my expectations. For what it was supposed to be or at least what I was assured it was from the masses, Very good authentic mexican food. I came with a party of three including I for a brunch breakfast meal, our server was a little tone deaf or hard at hearing maybe a combination of the two. When our orders were brought to the table we had items missing some that were requested and some that were supposed to be included with the meal or so the menu says but after my argument with my server he assured me I was wrong. The food itself was ok I did like it but my rice tasted a little dry how can something be wet and have a dry taste to it was it microwaved?

What I liked: The food. The tortilla chips were amazing, bean dip rocked (I inhaled it), shrimp ceviche (although since the shrimp was cooked, it's not ceviche) and the tamales. The service was very attentive, especially to make sure my iced tea was filled. Food came out rather quick, too, which was nice.  What I didn't like: Not having a tamale specific option. I had to order them a la carte or with an option I didn't want. I also didn't like the condition of the menus. When a restaurant's (large) pages stick together, I want hand sanitizer provided. There's no reason for them to stick together if you would wipe them down daily.  The food was just too good so it gets 4 stars.
This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in all of Vegas. The food is all made from scratch and the service is always great. Great Caritas and the rid eye is awesome.

Typically, WHAT HAPPENS IN VEGAS, STAYS IN VEGAS, right???  But I need to tell EVERYONE that WHENEVER IN VEGAS, you gotta make the drive out to visit Viva Zapatas!!!  THIS PLACE IS WONDERFUL!!  From the decor, to the food, to the music, its all amazing!!!  The owner greets you personally and can I just say that he is great!  Thanks for tequila shot on my bday!!!  woot woot!!  VIVA VIVA ZAPATAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is my go-to Mexican restaurant in North Las Vegas! On the weekends, you will find a live mariachi band performing around the dining room. Stop in on your birthday for a fun mariachi style tequila shot.  The food is typical Mexican offerings and even offers tongue tacos.   The service sometimes can be a little slow, but usually the wait staff is on top of it.   Parking is always a problem when they are busy. So you might be stuck parking down the street or waiting for a car to pull out.

The food here was incredible! The portions were very filling and most everyone takes home leftovers. The flour tortillas are homemade and delicious! This was the best Mexican I've eaten and I would definitely recommend it.
Good food, a bit of a wait but was satisfied with the food and staff ,will recommend to anyone that asks "where should I go eat today"

If you can't find a spot to park, then there is a good chance you are about to eat a good meal! Cute quaint little restaurant. Outstanding made to order table side, guacamole dip! Generous portions, and super speedy service. There's nothing I hate more than to wait around for a long time for food with two small kids. Courteous staff too! This is only my second time eating there, I am certain to go back. And to save money, I will make sure to go at lunch time. The lunch menu will save you a few bucks, and you get the same great food!

Right off the Craig Rd. exit on the 15 North is a great little Mexican restaurant called Viva Zapatas. It's a relatively small spot that you would probably miss if you weren't looking for it. The food is excellent, but the parking is tight. Zapatas makes for a great lunch spot or a great dinner place to wow your out of town guests. The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere and features a cool bar in the center of the restaurant with a couple of over head tv screens so you won't miss the big game. You can find a picture or two of Emilliano Zapata hanging on the walls along with a few other eclectic Mexican artifacts. The food is excellent! They start you off with chips, salsa, and beans. This place reminds me of a great Mexican restaurant that is no more called Sal's Mexican Inn in Oxnard,Ca. Go with a combination plate, no need for an appetizer because the portions are good. I like the #4 combo which is a pork burrito, chicken enchilada, chicken taco, and rice and beans. I like to substitute the chicken taco for a chorizo taco. I'm not sure if the chorizo taco is even on the menu, but don't leave without one. They are excellent. The pork burrito is so tasty and the chicken enchilada pops off your plate and into your mouth. The enchilada is smothered in cheese just how I like it. Be sure to order the guacamole and watch them come over to your table and make it fresh in front of your eyes. The guacamole is first class. Zapatas also has a killer chile relleno. On the way out don't leave without what I call the best after dinner mints in town-undisputed. These little green babies aren't so minty, but more lemon limey. They will leave a refreshing taste in your mouth for the ride home. The bottom line is no matter what you order at Viva Zapatas you won't be disappointed, so if you're in Northtown you have to drop by.

The food was just ok but I'm originally from Southern California so I'm used to really good Mexican food. However, the mango margaritas were amazing. I would go back many times for margaritas and the sopapillas (dessert).

Everytime we go to Viva, food has been excellent. But the wait staff and the manager really make it a great dining experience.  They are really on the ball. The live music is a plus. Tortillas are handmade and the guacamole is made at your table to your tastes. Soup is great and the salsa and bean dip are sssooo good. Everything we have ordered have been great. From the tacos, steaks, and fried fish. Parking is limited so go early.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. This place has the best wait staff and the food is awesome. Having moved from Texas we were looking for some authentic Mexican food, and we definitely found it here. The atmosphere is nice as well; it's very laid back plus they have a live singer. What more could you ask for? All around it was an great experience that I will be doing again and again. This place made me miss home.

Perfect hidden gem! We grabbed the Botana Papa Pepe and Taquitos Dorados as takeout for the road. The service was very friendly and even on a packed night, they made my order before the time promised and even called me when it was ready as I gassed up the car. 3 appetizer orders total was perfect for our car of hungry travelers and my daughter now magically loves guacamole. Gracias and we'll be back.  PS- Jalape√±os were YUM!!

Fantastic restaurant. Despite it being packed, the service was prompt and the dining room was very clean. Everyone in my party loved what they got including myself. The two quesadillas I got had just the right amount of ingredients and two of the people I was there with raved about the chicken. The bathrooms were also very clean and the sinks were these cool copper basins. To top it off, the place was reasonably priced.

After reading the reviews in Yelp and a co-worker telling me about this place I have to say it was well worth the busy! The food was so good!!! This is the best Mexican food I've had in a long time! I had carne Asada enchiladas and my friend had the nachos along with Cadillac margaritas! I can't wait to come back and try some other entrees!!! Oh and customer service was amazing!
Best authentic Mexican food in Vegas! And the horchata is delicious! I have been to a lot of Mexican places that don't even compare. You have to try it to believe it!

Husband and I came in on a Wednesday at 8 to place a to-go order. We had quite a bit of sticker shock with the prices. Most plates ranged from $17-21. We went ahead and ordered two a la carte burritos hoping it would be worth it/generously portioned/something to justify the prices. Hostess was friendly and the food came out not particularly speedy but not slow enough to complain, and they did get our order correct (no easy feat, I am a picky eater.) The food itself however was average at best. The chile colorado was a little bland and tough, and was the ONLY thing in the burrito. Definitely would not have been worth paying full-plate prices. In fact I think I've had better tasting burritos for much less elsewhere. Overall the place is OK, but we are going to keep looking for our Mexican "spot.:

I don't really like Mexican food, but if that is what the day's food choice is, I'd pick Zapata's over any other Mexican restaurant in town!  The service here is always top notch, and since I work close by and have been here more times than I can count, it is a lot to say that the service has never let us down.  The food is top quality for Mexican food, from the shredded beef tacos to the enchiladas.  Nothing is ever served too salty or greasy, just perfect.  The lunch dishes come with a free drink, which is a great deal too!    My favorite dish has to be 16 on the lunch menu.  I can't remember the name, but it is basically a couple of slices of juicy chicken breasts topped with a creamy sauce, with beans and rice on the side.  with this special, you get your choice of homemade corn or flour tortillas (I prefer the flour, but they are both good).  And if you look at the southwest corner of the restaurant, you can see your fresh tortillas being prepared right on the spot!    Zapatas is a favorite in our community, and in Las Vegas in general.  I know people that come from across town to eat here.  It really is a top notch, affordable restaurant!

Love this place. Use to live down the street now moved to the other side of Vegas and I still drive all the way up there. The food and SERVICE is excellent. You will never have to worry about being ignored, their customer service is what sticks out to me the most and the food is a + . Love their avocado tacos!

Best spot I've been too that has authentic Mexican food to their chips and salsa and a side of refried beans.. to their fideo soup to start before u get your meal.. I had the green chilaquiles with carne asada which was a fulfilling meal and great flavor. As for my boyfriend had the tostadas of ceviche and that was a hit too.. I truly recommend this spot.. we look forward to coming to this spot again..thank you for the great service..

Worst restaurant ever, use to be real good but over the yrs it went down hill!  Guess their more into the money than the food ...  So where to begin ...  If u actually turn the lights up or use the light on ur phone you'll see that the place is really dirty and not clean.  My kid dropped his toy and I had to use my phone to look for it under the booth and it looks like it hasn't been swept in yrs.  The menus have old crusty food still on it and haven't been updated or replaced since the last time I was here in 2006.    Waiters are either rude or doesn't speak English, told him several times please quit grabbing stuff over my plate.  I will not be coming back to this place!

True to its theme, this restaurant offers great food and great service from the moment you walk in until you step out. The hostess was welcoming and prompt to seat us. Our server was friendly and efficient.

My family and I used to frequently visit this place a couple years back. We loved the authentic Mexican food and the nice service. But in the past year, this place has really gone downhill. Everytime we go it takes at least an hour for them to serve us and the food and salsa progressively get more salty and less flavorful. It's such a shame this place keeps getting worse.

Lucky for me the two women that I had a meeting with on the north side of town have eaten here..On the industrial side of Craig & I-15, chances of finding this on my own are slim.  I'm also very picky when it comes to Mexican food, not disappointed, this was a great find.   Then again, that was obvious when we had to wait a few minutes for a table. The place was packed and the aroma filling the air was mouth watering.   After being seated we were served chips with a bowl of salsa and a bowl of beans.  The salsa was very flavorful and this is the first time I have ever had bean dip that was seasoned (very tasty)   For lunch my client and I both ordered the Ensalad Marinara - large salad for less than $10, a great price for shrimp, avocado and pico de gallo. My business partner ordered the ceviche which she also said was very flavorful.   Food was good, service was great and everyone was very friendly.  Will definitely be back when on the north side of town!

First of all, it's in a horrible location unless you work out that way or drive a truck.  It's very dark inside with traditional decor.  Thbe menu is pretty extensive.  I ordered the chile colorado.  The gave free chips with warm refried beans and salsa.  The chips tasted slightly burnt and te salsa was kinda bland.  The colorado was a litte tangy and lacked the depth of chile flavor.  The service was good.  Not worth the trip out thee but decent if you are nearby.
The salsa is my fav! Everything in this restaurant is handmade from scratch nothing canned! I asked!!!! I haven't had one thing on the menu I haven't loved.  Its a  must for authentic Mexican food!

This is hands down the best Mexican food restaurant in Vegas to me. Every time I come here the food is amazing, and all the employees are super nice. The food is at a pretty moderate rate, but the food comes in great quantity is and delicious so it's well worth it. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a good restaurant!

I am gonna be as honest as i can reviewing this restaurant. It appears that I am the only one in the party of 15 we had that didn't really like this place. We came here on the recommendation of my father in law, who figured we'd all need menudo to cure our hangovers this past Saturday morning. Maybe it was because I wanted a good ol' fashioned American breakfast or maybe because I have certain restaurants back home, but this place just didn't do it for me. With that being said, this is what I found:  LOCATION & DECOR  It was beautiful both inside and out. Bar area took up most of the restaurant. Major selection of tequilas. Seating for big parties wasn't the best and we must have taken up about 1/4 of the restaurant. Location is good for those visiting or stationed at Nellis Air Force Base, but bad for people staying on or near the strip, as it is a good 15 minutes from the Dowtown Las Vegas, 20 from the strip.  SERVICE:  Seating- We were seated right away, rare for such a big party, but we were there around breakfast time, so beat the rush.  Wating- Our server took the drink order right away, brought them out right away and the beers were ice cold, as well as the mugs we asked for, and the margarita drinkers in the party said that they were poured generously. This is where my low stars come into play. IT TOOK TWO HOURS FROM ARRIVAL TO DEPARTURE! We must have waited a good 45 minutes before all the dishes began to come out. We were brought out salsa, which was OUTSTANDING, refried beans w/ cheese, also pretty good exept for the big glop of cheese in the middle, and those kept coming out, but by the time the food had arrived, I was full!  FOOD:  I didn't like my machaca. I had the pork after being given the option of pork or beef. I should have went with my gut and gotten the beef. It was okay, but not a dish that said, "WOW". Although, I have to give credit to the waiter because when I asked him what was better between the machaca and the chilaquiles, he said go with the machaca, and even though it didn't wow me, he was able to recommend something to me, which alot of waiters can't or won't do. Now If I would have only asked him if the pork or beef were better, I might have enjoyed my meal more.  Some in my party ordered campechanas (seafood cocktails) and they were pretty much licking the sides afterwards, so they all seemed to enjoy it. My wife had a grilled chicken breast in a garlic sauce, and it was pretty tasty. A good friend ordered the Pipian, and she said it was some of the best she's ever tasted that isn't her mama's.  Overall, I think this place would be good for drinks and watching a game, as they had the Charger game on that day. It might even be good for a smaller group then ours, say 2-4 people, maybe no more than 6. Two hours is a long time to be in a restaurant, especially when most of that time is spent waiting on food to come out, and maybe it could have been because our group is so large, but I've had faster service in other restaurants with a group just as big. I might give it another shot one day, but not anytime soon!

Really delicious food but the front staff (specifically the lady with short hair and glasses) Elizabeth I believe her name was, spoke Spanish to our waiter the entire time we were checking out. She did that on purpose so we wouldn't know what she was saying, joke is on her, we are Filipino and understood everything. It's really rude to speak another language to your coworkers  in front of your customers. Unprofessional and such a shame because the food is awesome.   *went back a second time to see if anything has changed, and literally the entire staff spoke Spanish to us. Geeze. I guess it's a must to learn how to speak Spanish if you want to dine here.

This place is great. Have been there quite a few times and it is one of my favorites. The fideo soup that is given with every meal is great and I have even ordered a large bowl of it once.  The shrimp stuffed avocados, queso fundido, shrimp cocktails are awesome.  The service in the restaurant is pretty good but the bar is a little off. Every time I go they mess up the drink, never bring it, or bring the check when you ask. It isn't one bartender either, it has been a few different ones. Just order the drinks at the table and you will like it.

Best Mexican food hands down!!!! I have been searching for an authentic Mexican restaurant and I believe I've found it. We came for lunch & the food was awesome. They offer over 22 lunch specials that all come with rice, beans & tortillas. Let's not forget the complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip. The salsa was LEGIT lol none of that generic watery salsa from a container. It was roasted from chilies and perfection to my mouth. Lol overall it's an awesome place with great food & service! Must try!!!

Ate at the bar for dinner. Gracie made me an awesome skinny margarita and hubby had a yummy house margarita. Totally agree with other reviewers. Salsa and beans with chips were yum! The soup they give us good too.   I had the #1 combo with a chile relleno, beef taco and chicken enchilada. Hubby had shrimp fajitas. Fajitas were good -normal fajitas. Coming from So Cal, I know good Mexican food. My dinner was one of the best I have had!   They also had a great guitar player which made for a really cool atmosphere. Will definitely come here next time through Vegas!
Hands down, best service I have ever gotten! Wow, very attentive and great food. Love the chips and salsa.

I ended up in this place after a 6 hour flight between Ford Airport in Michigan and Chicago's O'Hare. By the time I got to Vegas I was tired, hungry and in need of a drink. I ended up walking into this place during Happy hour. Within minutes there were two huge margaritas on the rocks with extra salt in front of me and an encyclopedic menu of house specialties in my hands! So far so good!   The guacamole, house salsa and chips were great. The all inclusive sampler appetizer was more then three people could go through and the portion sizes were borderline gluttonous...everything was perfect. I had the Pollo Sarandeado Estilo "Rebelion". It was spicy enough to order another margarita but flavorful and not over the top with heat.   The service and ambiance was wonderful. The waitstaff was prompt and on their best game and the drinks and food kept coming throughout the night. There were also decommissioned rifles and other weapons all over the walls and seeing how I was there to attend a military course, I felt right at home. I'll definitely come here again!

Husband and I were looking for a fiesta of flavors- this place was decent, however for the price it was a bit of a let down. The opening snacks of chips and salsa and refried beans were amazing and very addictive. Salsa had good flavor and spice. Then came the complimentary soup that comes with every entr√©e. This was pretty good as well- at most places it has an overly tomato taste, but it was more subdued here which I like. But nothing to run home and rave about- at the end of the day it's just a little broth with some noodles. Now to the main course: Tacos de pescado- The fish was breaded and fried served in a flour tortilla. Just because something is fried doesn't mean it has to completely lack flavor. There was absolutely zero seasoning. I had to drench the tacos in the sauce that came on the side in order to get any flavor, and then all I ended up tasting in the end was the sauce. Beef Fajitas- again the meat completely lacked flavor. We were looking for spice or something and just got overdone chewy pieces of steak. For a $17 entr√©e we were very disappointed. And the meat to pepper ratio was horrible. There was barely enough meat to make two tacos and the plate was piled high with so much filler- onions and bell peppers.  Overall- these two dishes weren't home runs, but I can see that this place has the potential to produce delicious dishes however I probably will not be returning to find out.

Loved this place! Found this place through yelp! Service was great, super clean and friendly. Not to mention, their food was Delicious! We ordered the steak cilantro, chile verde quesadilla and chicken burrito (enchilada style). Portion sizes are huge so try not to get full on the chips salsa and beans. :)

The Best Mexican Restaurant in Vegas. I am visiting North Las Vegas which is bit of a dump and has no good restaurants, then, I found VZ's a Gem of a place tonight. Great food, excellent service and some live but soft music. Couldn't believe the portions you get and the attention from the Waiters. Full meal at under $20.00.  I don't expect to be around this area much but I would go out my way to come here from downtown when I am. Hard to find due to construction: across from Jack in the Box and next to Pilot. 10/10 for me
The food was delicious! Great atmosphere and good music. Our service was a little slow (reason for the 4 star) but we weren't in a rush.

We usually always end up at Lindo Michoac√°n by Las Lomas in Henderson but we wanted to try somewhere else. I've always passed by Viva Zapatas and I told my husband we should try it out. Well...here it goes.  There was a 15-20 minute wait (which I don't mind because it was a Mother's day Weekend). I pictured the restaurant waaaay bigger but I was wrong. The entrance is so small that if you do have to wait just know that you're gonna be waiting outside in the heat.   The table that they gave us was near the entrance. I wanted to switch tables BUT I knew that was gonna be another 20 minute wait and we were already starving. Anyways, it was pretty dark inside. Felt like we were some dam vampires.  Now to the food....so....if I would of known that they pretty much did the exactly same thing as Lindo Michoac√°n, I would of just gone to Lindo Michoac√°n. The chips and dips are pretty much the same. Oh and let's not forget the fideo. Which by the way had no taste at all AND pretty much there was no fideos in my dam soup! Huh!? Felt like I was drinking colored water. But I will give them this...I ordered a combo of chile rellenos without the sauce. That was some good ass Chile rellenos. The beans were pretty good and the rice was ehh...but I wasn't super impressed.   The service was okay....  I wouldn't come back.  P.S. I was gonna give them two stars BUT the chile rellenos saved them.

How lucky am I? After returning to Las Vegas from golfing at Wolf Creek I happened to stop for gas at a seven eleven and asked the lady behind the counter if she could recommend a good Mexican restaurant. Of course she directed me a mile up the road to Zapatas. There were no large tables available so they sat me across from the bar at a little two seater table. The chips salsa and beans practically followed me to the table....amazingly quick service. The wait staff offered service with a smile and the food was delectable! The offerings are so vast I had trouble deciding between a burrito or the pollo a cognac. The waiter steered me towards the chicken dish and I wasn't disappointed. The creamy sauce was out of this world and the chicken was tender and sauteed with onions and mushrooms. I was pleased to stumble upon this local gem and you better believe I will go out of my way to return on my next trip to sin city!

Personally this is one the best places to have great Mexican food, next to Las Islitas off Las Vegas blvd and Carey. Chips and salsa are great, and the food is always good!!! Only problem I have with this place is how small it is. Try coming here for a date night on a Saturday evening....you'll be waiting for a good while sometimes depending on how busy it is. If you've ever had Lindo michoacan then expect the same kind of taste in food...because both business are family related.

I loved this place. My spouse and I ate here tonight and the sopitas we're wonderful, the flautas we're crispy and fresh, and the enchiladas hit the spot. Chips, salsa, and beans without a word to start. Excellent margarita, so my better half attests. The service was impecable (we are both former servers). Laid back, low key, just right. We will be back.

The food was so bland and we were very disappointed in our food. We ordered the sandwich and it had barely any meet on it and no spice or flavor at all! This is a awful choice if you are vegetarian there are no options, I ordered vegetarian burrito and it was a flour tortilla with bland veggies and that's it! I was so bummed I had to spend my money! Oh! And the prices!!!! $12 for my veggie burrito! Never coming here again!

Great food! Chips were good but slightly greasy. Bean dip amazing!! My husband practically ate the whole thing!! Very generous serving. I ordered the Zapata Burrito and it was ginormous!! Honestly you could share it with another person or two. I only ate a quarter of it and was stuffed. Definitely would go back if I was in the area!!
Awesome food! LOVE the grilled fish tacos & margaritas!

Love the food here! And oh the bean dip and guacamole are heaven :) I get the steak salad - yummy! The shrimp in some sort of lemon garlic stuff is really good too! Only downfall is price, I always come out spending Wayyy more than intended (thus the reason for 4 stars wish I could do like 4 1/2)

Hidden gem! I was absolutely blown away by their service. From the outside, it just looks like a plain Mexican food joint next to a truck stop. Then inside decorations,music, and lighting transport you to festive Mexico.   The table side prepared guac was amazing. The staff are quick and friendly. Chips, drinks, sauces were refilled without havering to flag anyone down. Host was knowledgeable about the menu since there was a large selection of authentic food.   I've literally passed by this place hundreds of times on Craig. And now I think I've found my new local spot.

This place is amazing! Above and beyond GREAT service, incredible food, and a huge selection of beers and Tequila. There were 3 of us. .we tried the Tilapia (whole) slightly dry but VERY tasty, Carne Asada - OMG good, and the cheese enchiladas exactly what you expect.  We also had the guacamole made table side. ..the waiter was extremely entertaining and full of joy!  Best service we have had at any restaurant in months!  You won't be disappointed! !!!!!

Were do i start? I have been coming here since i have lived in Las Vegas. That will be about 14 years. It has the best carne asada and chips and salsa. Gosh they load u up on the chips salsa and bean dip. My favorite thing to eat here is there shreeded beef crunchy tacos. The fideo soup reminds me of when I was a kid. If you want the best meal on this side of town. This is the place. American or mexican this is the best resteraunt in the North!

Needed a quick dinner near Nellis, so we took the family to Zapatas.  How amazing!  I've lived and traveled throughout the southwest, and this was fantastic Mexican cuisine.  I had the Carne asada plate at the waiter's recommendation.   It was perfect.  The Pico and guacamole served with it were also spot on.  If only I could have finished it after the fresh chips, salsa, and  bean dip which was served complimentary.    The kids meals were also great and the adults enjoyed yummy frozen margaritas.  We will definitely be returning often.  While totally worth the wait, make sure you allow plenty of time at dinner as it took awhile for all our fresh food to be prepared. Service was excellent and very attentive.

We were in Vegas for the week for my daughter's wedding and wanted to try someplace different...not a chain, not on the strip, but great none the less....we found it in Viva Zapatas!  We went on a Monday night, and made reservations since there were going to be about 10 of us. We only had to wait about 10 min. after we got there, no problems at all. It isn't very big, but it's decorated wonderfully and it doesn't feel crowded at all, just right. One thing I loved is that the entire time we were there there was a 1 man mariachi playing a guitar and singing live. I don't know if he is there all the time or not, but I loved it...just added to the ambiance.  We ordered an appetizer of Queso Fundido con Chorizo in addition to the complimentary chips, salsa, and frijoles. Oh my goodness! It was the best, cheesiest, sausage-y goodness ever!  Our table also ordered a pitcher of Cadillac Margs...the "pitcher" was more of a carafe, but the margs were delish!  With 10 of us there were a variety of entrees ordered and everyone loved theirs. Mine was a cheese enchilada and chili relleno, both were delicious.  Flan for dessert topped off the evening perfectly.   When I'm in Vegas again I will definitely go back!
The best ribeye in Las Vegas and they have the best tableside guacamole and Sylvia our server was the best. Everything perfect!!!!!!!!

Just started using Yelp and this place is excellent. I originally thought the reviews might be over-exaggerated but the food is very authentic and the service is great. The drinks are good too. We enjoyed the lunch specials.

I've eaten here many times. It's proximity to home and work made it my go-to Mexican spot most of the time, but it's not my favorite spot, or favorite Mexican in Vegas. It's pretty good, a must try.  I'm not their biggest salsa fan, but it's spicy so I enjoy that. The table side guacamole is very good. The menu is large, items are  priced a bit higher than I prefer, but the portions are huge. I've enjoyed their quesadillas with shrimp, avocado shells stuffed with shrimp and pico, and most of all the fideo. Honestly, I always came for beer and fideo. I felt the fish and shrimp tacos were quite bland, and the burritos are packed with way too much meat and nothing else.  The service is always friendly. It gets very busy here, so beware of that. I have waited longer than I'd like to admit for food here. A decent spot, but not the best.

Best Mexican sit down restaurant we have found in Vegas. It's a hidden gem in an industrial area of town, but it never disappoints. The waiters are always very friendly and remember us when we come in. Their portions are large enough you could share. Their drinks are delicious, but their homemade tortillas are why we frequent this restaurant so often!

It was pouring when we came here, but yet it was super busy. My two friends and I came on a Sunday night, around 6:30 or so and someone held the door for us and welcomed us in. It was really dark inside, which made it kind of difficult to read the menu (the words were small too) but the booths were comfy, it was warm and the music was good. We were given chips, salsa and beans while we waited for our server.   My friends ordered a large margarita which was surprisingly good and very strong. After our server took our drink orders and dropped off our waters, he disappeared for 10 minutes. I am not exaggerating, waiting 10 minutes to order is not acceptable. My friends were sure he forgot about us.   Finally, we were able to order our food but by then we had already filled up on chips and salsa (the busboy refilled it for us twice already). Instead of ordering the chicken enchilada, chicken taco and tamale combo I got the beef enchilada and tamale combo instead. My friends stuck with their steaks, one ordered the Cola steak and not sure what my other friend ordered.   We were all given a tomato based soup to start off with. My friend said that it usually tasted better, and was kind of bland today. I tried it, and it did taste a bit watered down, I added some salt and pepper to it but didn't care for it much.   My friends ordered guacamole, which was made table side. One guacamole was used along with probably half of a tomato... was it worth the $8? Not so sure, but it WAS good.  The steaks and my combo came with rice and beans, my friends' steaks were supposed to come with tortillas but they didn't and by the time the server checked up on us, they didn't want them anymore. The beef enchilada was filling, lots of shredded beef and it wasn't too salty! I was too full to try my tamale but did get a bite of my friends' steaks. Both were very soft, and well seasoned. I didn't like the cola steak because it reminded me of a cola flavored bbq sauce that was overly sweet.   Unfortunately since we filled up on chips, we only had a couple bites of our food and asked for the rest to be boxed up. Our server wasn't around much, but the busboy was amazing and very attentive. He boxed up our food, tableside and was the person refilling our chips and waters.   Our server came by, asked us if we wanted dessert and we said no, just the check. Then, he left somewhere, and a few minutes later came back to ask us if we wanted dessert again.   It was a 25 minute drive from my place, but I wanted to come here because my friends raved about it. After my initial experience, I don't think I'll be coming back here anytime soon and will just stick to someplace closer to me.

Horrible service. I didn't even get to eat the food because I was waiting so long. They guaranteed that if we sat at the bar we would get a table within 10 - 15mins. That didn't happen in fact it looked like they forgot about us. I even inquired about our placement and they ensured they didn't forget. Plus they said oh we will get you guys menus and they never did. of course I attempted to ask but couldn't get anyone's attention so we left. Do yourself a favor and go to some other Mexican restaurant if you want to eat and be served properly.
Once again, Viva Zap's delivers! Love the Grandma Mag's chicken!  Serrandiado sauce is positively incredible.
I just love this place! The beans are to die for & the flavors NEVER disappoint me. no one is ever unpolite! Just freaking love it!

I've been coming here for years, the service is always on point, the food here is always fantastic and the ambience is great with a live guitar player in the evening, their fresh baked flour tortillas remind me of my grandmas hot buttery delicious home made tortillas.., like I said, I've been coming here for many years, we love it!!
This is the best Mexican food in town. The margarites are off the hook. They have a friendly staff who makes great recommendations.

I've visited this place 3 times in the past year.  I'm from California...but whenever I'm in town i make a point to come here. It sometimes has a wait but that's because the corn tortillas are made fresh on site and the micheladas are outstanding! I've brought my toddlers here and they love the chips which are served with a bowl of warm refried beans along with salsa. They have a great kids coloring menu with several choices.  They also have a small bar,  if you're not dining with kids. This visit, the service was less than great and the hostess was pretty inept but in the past the service was wonderful. I will be back.

I've been here many times when they have their lunch specials. The prices are very decent, especially for the amount of food they give. The carne asada (#30) is soooo good. The servers are very friendly, too. Outside of the lunch specials, they offer military discount which is another plus! The only thing I don't like about it is they will only discount the food the military member gets even if that person is paying for the entire party's bill.

Real good authentic Mexican food is not limited to tacos. There is such a wide variety, and it differs from east to west and north to south! Viva Zapatas has definitely hit that note straight on! The food is based off of traditional cuisine from the state of Morelos in Mexico. So it does tend to be heartier, earthier foods since Morelos is landlocked, and not as much of the seafood stuff. But they do offer a variety of shrimp dishes, and a couple of fish ones.  The ambiance is very unique. Tons of old "ranchero" artifacts adorn the wall. Colorful picados hang in the halls. And of course lets not forget the man himself Emiliano Zapata (for whom the restaurant is named) in a vintage frame!  Now - to the food. Before you plan your visit for dinner - starve yourself for most of the day! (or be prepared for lots of leftovers)!! :D Haven't been there for lunch service but just might have to one of these days.  Once you are seated, you immediately are brought tortilla chips, refried beans, and salsa (red). Now, I will warn you - don't finish the tortillas off! (they bring you more, it's the neverending pit of chips!) So unless you want to fill up on chips and dip, back off them! (I prefer to add a splash of lime to mine, so they definitely accommodate). You are also brought an appetizer soup - I don't know what it is. But the best way I can think of it - chicken noodle meets tortilla soup!  Last time I had eaten here, I had the mole served up with beans and rice - and it was superb! Portion was HUGE so everyone in the group had doggie bags heading home.  This time round I wanted to do something a little different - so I went for the 'Pollo con napoles" (Chicken with Prickly Pear Cactus). VERY deeeeeelicious! Had just the right touch of heat, and seasoned beautifully with the cilantro and other veggies. ($14 entree) Now here is the part that had me craving the "tortillarias" that I used to see on the streets of mexico - fresh, homemade, tortillas! And when I say fresh - I mean they have a gal working her tail end off mixing the dough up portioning it out, and cooking it all up on a traditional griddle. So if you have a small enough party and want to entertain your little one, ask for the table close to the tortilla zone so the little one can watch the tortilla making process! And yes they offer you the choice, corn or flour for your tortilla.  I can't remember what the other members had in our party, one had the combo 2, another had the fajitas i think. But all I can remember is hearing everyone going - "wow, this is REALLY good food!" And yes we brought home all the leftovers! Had them for our lunch today, and both hubby and I still have more leftovers for lunch tomorrow! So yeah $14 entree spllt into 3 meals! :)   I know this is a longwinded review - but have to just really lay it all out on the line for you! Almost done - just got the service to go over, and you'll be done.  Service: impeccable! Everyone from the entrance to the bus boys are extremely professional and EXTREMELY polite! They do everything they can to ensure you are satisfied with your meal, and are very quick to refill your glass (or ask about it) if they it is going on empty.  Still want more?   Well, stop reading and go drive there and discover this place! :)
Good food, good prices!  Very similar to Lindo Michoacan.  Enjoyed the ambiance and the service was great.
I have been eating here for many years the food is the best and i have always been overly satisfied when i eat here.

The after dinner mint on the front counter caught my attention more than the food we paid for. Bland, overpriced, tasteless are just a few of the adjectives I'd use to describe  'Viva's' food. I'm sorry, but refried beans and pre-cooked rice are not authentic Mexican. Unless you consider Del Taco authentic. If you do, I feel sorry for you.  They were busy, and we waited for half an hour. That is not a complaint. Just a fact.  Once seated the waiter appeared quickly to take our drink order. (Margaritas) Those were fine. Chips and salsa soon followed. Salsa was as bland as the refried beans that came at the same time.  The menu is extensive, but I'd venture a guess not much different than what we ordered. Bland.  I had a combo with beef, ( had a huge blob of fat in the middle) pork in a salsa verde (green salsa) and a very greasy chicken taco. With of course, red rice and beans.  My fianc√© had chicken enchiladas in a flavorless green sauce. To be fair, she enjoyed the rice.   Save some money, go to the Del Taco.

Well overdue update ...my third party experience did this place no justice! AT ALL!! I recently have been ordering shrimp dishes off their lunch special menu and let me tell you they are all awesome! You receive a fideo soup and a drink on the side! Most dishes come with rice and beans, and I always ask for habanero salsa! The wait times are lengthy, but the food is always fresh and the customer service is great every time!   My only suggestion is order your food, wait 10 mins,   then leave home. That way you don't blow your gas in the parking lot or waste precious time cramped in the small waiting area!

Great service and great food! Extremely family friendly, and most of the time, there's a live musician setting an authentic mood. I come here often with my daughter (16 mos), because they take very good care of you. They bring out a small plate of rice, veggies and meat for the little one(s) very early, sometimes before I've made up my mind about what I want to eat.  The tortillas are made fresh, you can watch the lady make them, and so is the guacamole, which they'll put together right in front of you. Oh, and if you think decorations stop at the bathroom door, think twice. These bathrooms are NICE! I know that's an odd thing to notice, but it did make an impression on me. :) They're also honest about their mistakes. My friend and I wanted to try a new dessert they were offering. We had already paid for it, when the manager found out they didn't have anymore, so he gave us TWO desserts of our choice, even though we had only paid for one.

Another surprise Yelp find for me! I had never heard of this place or even see it, even though I've driven by a billion times. It's kinda small but they seem to move pretty quickly so if you do wait, it shouldn't be long.  The food here is excellent! If you're a fan of guacamole, make sure you try the fresh guac here. A waiter will come out with fresh avocados, all the fixings and make it exactly how you want...so good! Their chips are homemade and they also have a really good fideo soup. I ordered shrimp ceviche for my dinner which was alright but definitely not the best I've had. My wife had chicken fajitas which was great and I would definitely recommend it.   Aside from the food, this restaurant has some of the best service I've ever gotten. The staff is friendly and ridiculously fast at getting what you need. My drink never came close to being empty. Their menu is also pretty big so there's something for everyone here. I'd come back, even if just for the great service and killer fresh guacamole!
The service is always great not to mention the quality of food never changes ... Totally worth every penny

Wonderful Mexican restaurant. Full-bar with nightly music. Terrific full-service staff, where guacamole is prepared table-side. We wanted for nothing, including the house merlot, which was more than adequate for our meals.  I enjoyed the chili verde, which is my standard dish for a new Mexican restaurant. Save room for desserts.  Enjoy!
Called in to go order of 4 quesadillas it took 45 minutes from time of order to walking out of the Resturant... Good food but their take out process needs some work.

Excellent service & food! Went in on a Sunday around 1pm & we had a great experience. The atmosphere is warm & the waiters are dressed like mariachi men, our waiter was Jesus and he was amazing!! Some of the best service I have had in a while! The food was delicious real Mexican food! I would definitely return!!   We had the cilantro steak & shrimp ceviche that came with fresh homemade tostadas, delicious!!!!
This place is amazing. Excellent service, delicious food with generous portions. Table side prepared guacamole is worth it. There was even live music when we were there.

Good food and good service. Hard to find a decent restaurant in North las Vegas. This is my go to spot for Mexican food up here. Prices are fair and definitely cheaper than the chain restaurants. They have an assortment of combo meals if you have a hard time deciding.  The guacamole is made fresh right in front of you and the salsa and beans are served with a smile.
The worst $19 margarita I ever had. The food isn't any better than Roberto's. I'll never go back.

Such a great restaurant that is ALWAYS busy but very accommodating. Truly delicious and entertaining venue.  They have an extensive menu with some authentic Latin recipes. Staff is always very friendly and extremely kind. I love that my cup is never less than half full. It's appreciated, the minor details.

Service and atmosphere are a definite 5, but the food kinda sucked. I have to believe that we ate there on a bad night with a new cook who I hope was promptly thrown out of the building by a torch wielding mob. The salsa was spicy, but had no other flavor. The chips were standard. We wanted to have some queso dip with jalapenos, but they don't serve that, but whatever, not a big deal. We got some sort of combo dinner which started with soup. The soup tasted like a can of condensed tomato soup with some noodles thrown in. my entree was incredibly bland. I had some sort of burrito and enchilada, neither of which had any flavor at all. My boyfriend's food was bland as well. The only thing that was any good, was the refried beans... and even that wasn't all that great, because, well.. They're refried beans. :P Will not be returning unless they get a new cook. Service however, was perfect.

What a surprise.  On the industrial North Side of town.    Guacamole made table side to taste.  Food was great, service was dialed in.  Price was reasonable.  Beats the heck out of those strip restaurants that shine up for tourists.

Close to Nellis AFB, one of the closest mexican sport bar around... Overall review was awesome... Our waiter Antonio was excellent at providing excellent service by being aware of all his tables.. Making sure our chips and dips was never empty.. And his sense of humor is great.. He was always polite and always have a smile on... Their live musician has a very strong voice and very good on the guitar.. Atmosphere was dark-- setting the bar mood but really bring you into the Mexican theme..! Food was amazing-- the chips bean dip and salsa was unlimited and very delicious, I had their enchiladas de mole.. Which was rich with mole sauce but a bit too cheesy for me.. But still Sooooo Gooodddd!! You got to try this if you're ever around Nellis AFB! Or just in Vegas itself!!
The atmosphere inside was very nice and clean. The waiter was very attentive and pleasant but I didn't think the food was that great.

My family and I have been here several times and EVERY time it has been great! The food is delicious and authentic, the service is courteous and fast (a big plus when you have little ones), and the live music is nice. We love this place and always bring family that's visiting from out of town to Viva's.

Me Being Mexican. The Food was not great. Not 100% Authentic Flavor seems the rice and beans are can food not made from scratch.  2nd time igo give a try again. Not worth for the price. Fideo Soup was good. Finished my food and tortillas never arrived.

The service here was amazing. They have Mexican beers on draft that most places don't. I loved their chips and salsa, they brought a cup of fideo before my entree, which was delicious. I had the shrimp tacos which were very good. They sometimes have live music, so it's a nice atmosphere. If it wasn't on the other side of town I would definitely come here more.

Whao!  This is authetic mexican food. The chips were fresh, beans were delicious, the salsa was perfect. Noy to mention the guacamole, it was made to perfection. The food was beyond delicious. I will be back.
