Affordable Mexican food with an authentic Mexican taste is hard to come by. Viva Zapata's is just that. A great atmosphere and even better food, Viva Zapata's has become my go-to restaurant for Lunch and Dinner. The customer service is head and shoulders above any other restaurant in the area. The front desk staff, the wait staff, and the bus staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The food is prepared quickly and I am always able to get in and out for lunch in less than 45 minutes. When I have a big group the staff always accommodates us and we always leave satisfied. I will continue to support this wonderful business and I will always recommend it to my friends!

This place is delicious, always packed so expect a wait if you're going in the evening for dinner.   I love their sopapillos, the chorizo ones, the carne asada sopapillos are not that great. Their chips and bean dip are addicting so prepare to be stared at when you continuously ask for refills lol ( it will happen) . The steak burrito and Steak Entree are also a hit. A huge plus are the home made tortillas made to order. You can even order a pack to go. I've been here several times and have ordered take out as well. On sick days I've been by to pick up their Caldo de Res. Big chunks of res and plenty of veggies.   Oh and of course you must always try a Margarita which they make pretty good ones.

Food: great variety and lots of vegetarian options. We tried several different salsas on our foods, and all added distinct appealing flavors to the fresh hot food.  Atmosphere: truly committed to creating an old town cantina interior--it was a true departure from the busy intersection outside and you could refocus on the food and your company. You also get to learn a little history in the menu too--cool!  Service: prompt, friendly, and offered helpful suggestions where we needed them.

The food was delish! The Atmosphere was great! The bar stools were horrendous, they killed our backs! Won't be sitting at the bar waiting for our table = Lost bar revenue! They need additional parking, circled their inadequate,  small parking lot for 20 minutes,  1 handicapped spot! Great food, but not worth the trouble.

Table side guac is great, distinctive mexican dishes prepared with care.  It looks as good as it tastes.  Lunch is a little less money, but the real deal happens with the full menu.  Also like the guitar man and it is busy, but a nice atmosphere.  Second time there and I'm bringing my mexican son-in-law back next time.   I vote yes.
I have been there 5 times and great time. They are pretty fast a lunch. Food has been very good each time. Absolutely nothing negative to say about the place.

My family ( husband, 3 kids under 12) came here from yelp recommendation.  First of all the service was absolutely amazing!   We got the guacamole and they make it table side! Food was very good. I got the shrimp enchiladas and they were very tasty.  I was already so full from the yummy soup and chips and dip that I had to take most of it to go!

Clean, great atmosphere. I love that they bring out refried beans with the salsa! I wasn't a fan of the salsa, or the soup they brought out. My chimichanga was delicious and so was my husband's enchilada, taco, and tostada. We definitely will return!

I came in for lunch and just barely beat the rush. It was just after 11 am and the parking lot filled up quickly. Inside the dining area there is an okay amount of room with options for a booth or table, but sometimes there is still a small wait to be seated since it gets so busy. There was a good amount of staff on hand to take care of the customers and during my visit our server checked on us often. We started with complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip. The salsa had a fresh taste, but I didn't care for it and it was think instead of thick which I personally prefer. Chips and bean dip were great. The beans really had a nice flavor.   The menu has a lot of options. On the back of the menu there were over 30 different combinations for lunch specials. The specials run from 10 am - 5 pm Monday thru Friday with prices ranging from $8.95 - $11.95 and meals include rice, beans and drink. Priced at $9.95 I chose a beef taco and cheese enchilada. The taco was filled with a nice portion of shredded beef and had tons of freshly grated cheese. I loved the taste of the taco shell and all of the cheese, but the beef lacked flavor for me. The cheese enchilada was really good and they didn't skimp with cheese inside or out. The beans like the dip didn't disappoint however there could have been more cheese on the beans. The rice was a bit dry, so I'll just get all beans next time. I was stuffed at the end of my meal and satisfied. Solid spot for lunch or dinner and great for the whole family.

As good as it gets indeed! I've been to this spot before but only for a few drinks at the bar. I knew I wanted to come back and try the food as the place always had a good friendly vibe. I am so glad I finally did! The food was amazing. I'm from San Diego and my girlfriend is from El Paso, so we are very accustomed to the cuisine from both nearby border cities of Tijuana and Juarez. If you are looking for flavorful authentic Mexican dishes then Viva Zapatas is your spot! The service was top notch. Our waiter always made sure that we were well taken care of. When we were finished and asked for a box to go, the bus boy came over and packaged it up for us which was a very polite gesture. We will be back!

Party of 8, sat right down, salsa dip and bean dip are addicting and the chips came out just made fresh. Service is excellent and the atmosphere is cozy. Loved it. 20 years in Vegas and still my favorite.

What a great place! Even though it is far out in the North East Vegas areas well worth the drive.  I had the pollo con rajas!  Served with rice and beans and fresh home made tortillas! You just can't go wrong or get more authentic. When you are in the mood for some home cooking and you don't feel like taking the pans out this is a great place!

I didn't like the food here. The salsa literally smelled like farts and the main dishes were just average. The waitstaff took forever to get us drinks and then forgot about us after our food was dropped off. Super disappointed especially in the salsa the most. Yuck.

Move-over, Lindo Michoacan! These guys are legit! Ask for the guac dip, AMAZING! Love the decor, the Tia Maria making the hand made tortillas in the back, the music, the staff is wonderful.   I love absolutely everything on their menu. I've tried almost everything. Green Chilaquiles, Carne Asada, Fideo Soup, yummmm....Everything is good.  I hate that to come here I have to drive 45 + minutes from Henderson. :-( If ever in the North side of town and in the mood for some good, authentic Mexican, try this place.   UPDATE REVIEW:   After coming back a few times after writing my last review, I can't help to notice how much the quality of the food has gone down.   As a faithful customer of this place, I can say it is NOT what it used to be. They are so busy, service is terrible. The food now lacks authenticity. Tastes like they cook everything on the same pan.   Sad to see this place slowly start to slack and lose something so good...because they had it for a while. Hope things improve. I will not come back soon and spend $17 on a mediocre dish.  Step it up, Viva. Lindo Michoacan is starting to sound better than your place. :-/

Came here for a date night. The food was alright, the environment was nice, but the service sucked. The server didn't introduce himself and never came back to our table after taking the order. I'm all about good service and we just didn't get it here. Super bummed.
Fantastic and authentic food.  Great atmosphere and margaritas.  The wait staff is super friendly and helpful.

The food and wait staff were excellent. The food was authentic and plenty. Started off with great tasting chips (not the store bought ones), a smoky flavored salsa and bean dip. Then a small cup of delicious soup followed by my lunch.  The entree was very good. The staff was very attentive. I am very suspicious of Mexican food being good since I live in CA and Mexican food is a staple. I highly recommend this place for an off the strip experience with normal prices. Well worth it.

I've been trying to locate good Mexican in Las Vegas and this place takes it! This place is real home-made Mexican food! It's not too fancy though, I'm not about to shove out $20-25 for a carne asada plate when $10-15 seems more reasonable.   I had the green enchiladas with chicken and they were delicious. The chips, the refried beans, and the rice were great! I wasn't a fan of the salsa that came with the chips, but that's just me. My friends liked it and I'm a firm believer that you really can't have it ALL.   The service was professional and attentive. The setting was a little loud, but when I go to a Mexican restaurant I expect to have live (or some form of) music and to enjoy the general "ambiente".  This place had just that.   I will definitely be back with adults only to have some adult beverages also. If I could just place this restaurant closer to my house in Henderson!

Had lunch with a friend here and I have to say that the food was excellent.  The only reason I'm knocking it down was that the service was very slow.  It took some time to get our orders even though it wasn't very busy when we came in and several people who came in after we ordered got their orders first.  Thankfully neither of us had anywhere we needed to be so we rolled with it.  I would come back for the food, I just wouldn't try it when I had to be somewhere else in a certain time.

I love good, authentic Mexican food.  Unfortunately, I don't get to have it very often. Viva Zapatas was everything an authentic Mexican restaurant is supposed to be.  From the live music, to the very diverse menu, they really nailed it.  I had the Carne Tampique√±a (sp?), and it was fantastic.  Although cooked a little under, the quality ingredients and seasonings more than compensated...plus it probably tasted better at that temperature.  My only criticism was that the margaritas were too sweet--but that's probably reflective more of what people come in wanting.  I'll definitely be back and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal!  Oh...and come on a Saturday night for the music.

Being a truck driver I have tried a lot of different across the country this is one of the best finds I have found being a close walk from the truck stop had the beef fajitas this trip through the beef and peppers were seasoned perfectly very generous on that part could use a little more of the beans and rice that is really the only thing it lacked on with the fresh chips and tortillas service was quick and friendly will definitely be back when I come to las vegas

This place I have been coming to for awhile.. Never have I experienced hair in my food. When the Manager Ramon came out and pertained to tell me that the hair couldn't of came from his employees it came from the outside when people open the door. I couldn't but look at this man and say that is the dumbest excuse I have ever heard of WOW!!! I will not be back to this place it's a joke. Not to add the portion today was four pieces of shrimp one spoon full of rice and beans take was ridiculous expensive if you enjoy blowing money for less food then go to this place. I'm so disappointed overall. I hope the owner Lorenzo reads this and gets back to me.

I am still thinking about my Chile relleno and it has been hours since I ate it. The menu here is giant, with more items than you could ever hope to try in your lifetime. I would love to try all of the family recipes most of all because those are truly unique. The live music, the wait staff, and overall service are top notch. It is a louder restaurant, especially when someone has a birthday, but great for families and groups, while still maintaining enough intimacy for a possible date night environment.  The food itself shows devotion to small finishing touches and detail. Instead of plain rice as a side, veggies are mixed in. My dining companion ordered a burrito and it was nearly the size of a loaf of bread. For real, you will get enough food to take home, so be prepared to have a second and possibly third meal out of what you order!
I love this place! me and the fam go at least once a month! Very friendly service plus great food!
Love this place, food is awesome, restaurant is very clean.  Crunchy shrimp tacos, yummy
The place is great, food came super fast, It has been hard to find a good Mexican restaurant here in Vegas, but I think I found one

Normally not a huge fan of Mexican fare but I'd come back to this place perhaps every few months. Arrived during a busy lunch hour on a Friday and were seated instantly. We got the chips and three dips which were more delicious than my own meal. Ordered and got the horchata and it was made perfectly. Very authentic feel but kind of dimly lit even at lunch time. I got the taco bowl and my sister ordered a burrito. Waited a little over 35 minutes for our two entrees to come out which was kind of a long wait but we had chips so we were ok. The food was good, but I'd still prefer Chipotle. There was a birthday celebration and they sang happy birthday and brought all the servers out complete with instruments, it was fun to watch. I noticed there were many Mexicans there for their lunch, even a few construction workers and a good amount of older folks at the bar. Sadly our food took so long we had no time for dessert but overall the service was great, food was good and the wait time not the best. I recommend going at a time when it isn't busy.
Delicious, authentic Mexican food. Excellent service the music amazing. Love this place

Holy Frijole, is this place good.  Las Vegans usually place Lindo Michoacan at the top of the heap when it comes to Mexican dining, but my erudite palate says Zapata's is easily just as as good, and much more affordable.  I really cannot say enough good things about this cozy little joint.  It's as authentic as it gets, and the food here is so good I don't have a go-to plate.  I always spend a good deal of time browsing the generous menu to pick something new, and it has always been delicious.  The chips and salsa are homemade, and probably laced with something illegal because it's hard to put them down.  The complementary fideo soup with an entree is a really nice touch and quite delicious.  There's a lot of complex flavors going on in what usually is just noodles and broth.  As far as the entrees go, I've never had anything that wasn't just firing on all cylinders.  Most recently I had the Camarones Borrachos entree, which was shrimp cooked in tequila, and it was absolutely delicious.  Before that I had one of the carnitas dishes and it gave me a glorious food comma.  The margaritas are also some of the best around.  My only criticism of Zapata's is the parking situation.  It's a small, crowded lot and we often have to park at the gas station next to it, but it's a minor inconvenience compared to the quality of the food awaiting inside.  Highly, highly recommended.

Really great Mexican cuisine! The menu has great variety and the pricing is excellent, especially if you're used to heading to Roberto's. My boyfriend and I ate and had a dessert for under $30! The service was excellent; the wait for food was pretty average but there was always a server checking on us and making sure our drinks were full.   My boyfriend had a beef burrito that was so large, he had plenty to take to work to eat! And he loved it, also said it was even better as leftovers. I ordered the carne asada mixed greens salad; there was a bit too much dressing for my liking the meat was cooked beautifully and I really liked the lime dressing. we had sopapillas for dessert and they were delicious! perfectly flaky and the sauce was very yummy. I really wanted to ask for another order!  we can here on a Thursday night (7:30pm) and there was plenty of seating and no wait, so didn't experience the rush. all in all, we really like the place and plan to come back next time we need a Mexican fix!
Great food and great service try the shrimp enchiladas. Live music place is clean and nice decorated. I loved it.

I have ate a many Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas. Viva Zaptas is by far one of the best choices I've made when searching for authentic Mexican dining. Since my first experience I have been a reoccurring customer. Prices are low although quality of food is high. Great atmosphere along with selection of music.

We wanted to send off a co-worker friend on her last day with a little lunchtime mexican fiesta...Viva Zapatas baby. This is not a huge place so getting ten people at a table is a real challenge on a friday at  noon. Luckily we waited no longer that 10 minutes(approx 63% of one margarita) and were seated and served good chips and salsa immediately, The service is always friendly here but sometimes is I a bit slow- not today. usually get the roast pork torta and it was great as usual plus is served with very good steak fries. Mexican food w/ fries? Yeah, Im home.  The margaritas were refreshing and delicious and the food seem to be enjoyed by all. Start to finish w/ 6 seperates checks(!) we were out in about 50 mins...plenty of time to drive back to work and nap the rest of the day away.

We tried this place for the first time after reading the reviews on yelp.  Everything was amazing.  The margaritas were tasty.  The soup was flavorful.  The homemade chips were served with bean dip and salsa.  The shrimp dishes were great including the shrimp enchiladas!
Love this place! Amazing service. Fast and friendly. It's nice and cozy in there and no matter what you order it'll be delicious!
Good service. I had the #1 and the chili relleno was awesome and they use shredded beef in the taco versus ground. Tableside guacamole was good. The price is.in the middle but worth it.

The food here is excellent,  Cant go wrong with any dish here,  it's a upscale Hispanic restaurant with great atmosphere and hospitality. They make the guacamole in person at your table . Fresh tortillas. Be careful of the chips and salsa you will be full before your food arrives lol . The salsa is very blah in my opinion tastes funny. Most dishes here can be pricey within the $12.00 -$25.00 range. But they do have a lunch special menu with is worth catching.  Bar is located in the middle of the restaurant which you can also eat at. Parking lot is small and can be a pain to find parking if busy. The lighting is bad inside which is a missed opportunity for good pictures and food pictures.  Located near just off Craig and I-15 if your ever in the area and want some very good Hispanic food I do recommend. Go go go!

We walked into Zapatas at 2 in the afternoon on a Saturday. We had a party of 5. The restaurant was virtually empty. We ordered one margarita each, and snacked on the chips and salsa; excellent. Soon we began to wonder if the order for margaritas had gone through to the bar. We inquired, and were told " they will be here shortly". After waiting 20 minutes, our margaritas finally arrived. They tasted great, but were not worth the $14 charge. We asked, and there were only 2 shots of liquor in them. We then waited an additional 30 minutes from the time we ordered our food. The food was presented well, but upon the first bite, we noticed something was off. The shredded chicken in my husband's taco salad tasted and smelled like tuna! We were convinced it was tuna, and the waitress said that it indeed wasn't. My husband didn't finish his meal or get anything else because it literally smelled so disgusting. Then, I noticed that my salad was missing 80% of the ingredients that it included on the menu, and that my grilled chicken was dry and chewy. Our service was great, that was the one upside.

On the way back to Vegas from the Manheim Car Auction at lunchtime, I searched for Mexican Food on my trusty Yelp App, and found another Comida Paradise in Las Vegas. One would think I would have had my fill of Comida after El Sombrero but as my Uncle Chuck is fond of saying, in my family Mexican Food is just called "Food".  To start with, the exterior looks suspect, parked in the shadow of a gas station and just off the I15 Interstate Freeway, one would expect this place to be yet another Gringo Mexican Chevy's Franchise -- but no, far from it, this place serves up some serious SouthWest Mex. I ordered the platter with chicken enchilada, taco and tostada -- y ay caramba! Sabrosa! Even if you don't gamble, it would be worth moving to Vegas and finding a home midway between this place and El Sombrero.

While the food here is good, the service is horrible! I'm still here at the restaurant and I've been waiting for over an hour for an order of 3 tacos. Nothing cosmic. Ordered drinks and food at 11:32 and it is now 12:30 with still no food. If you decide to come here, be sure to allow 2 hours for your meal.

Super disappointed w/civiche de camarones.  Seriously lacked flavor other than lime.  Nice server, loved the tableside guac & all the chips and salsa.  Entrees took forever.  Exc margarita!  I would eat there again, everyone else liked their food.

Viva Zapatas is Muy Bueno! YUM! (Hope I don't offend anyone with my limited Spanish...originally from Hawaii... so sorry) In Hawaii, we say "Ono!".  Anyways, off track, here we go with the review! The restaurant is located on the north side of town going towards the Speedway just off of I15 on East Craig located next to a gas station. It is 1 block off I15. For you folks in Las Vegas or Henderson, this Mexican restaurant is well worth the drive north.  I had lunch with some co-workers after volunteering at Three Square (I highly recommend if you like to volunteer and give back to the community). There was a bit of a wait since it was about lunchtime on a Tuesday. Plus, we had to park on the other side of the gas station. Parking spaces are very limited next to tis restaurant.  I love the ambience inside the restaurant. High ceilings and vintage decor. Cool and comfortable as well.  The food was great. I had one of the lunch specials. I had the cheese enchilada with a beef taco. It came with rice and beans. While we waited for the meals to come out, we enjoyed chips with salsa and bean dip. Good Stuff! Their regular size margarita was cool and refreshing. Glad I had the regular size, it was big as it was. I can't imagine the larger size.  So get your sombrero on and V√°monoso to Viva Zapatas soon!

This is one of those places that when you see it for the first time, second time or eighth time that you will not stop and eat.  It is located on Craig road near the I15 and right next to the Pilot truck stop on your way north. I made that mistake for to long and then finally convinced my self to try it. It has a small parking lot and even  walking to the door you are still not sure ... but when you enter - Oh Yes. The decor is rustic with historical items placed around the large dining room and bar. The booths are great and the staff is very friendly. A great atmosphere with live music on most every night. ( keyboards or guitar)  The traditional mexican food is super, the guacamole is out of sight and the sea food dishes are excellent. It is totally inexpensive and you will leave "Stuffed to the Max  - and happy that you are."  It is well out of the way for most people, but if you have that need to visit the Cannery Casino, it is right on the way and should not be missed.  Just don't let the location throw you off from the enjoyment of a supurb mexican dining experience.
Somewhat perplexed by the recent negative reviews I have read.. I have been dining there for over ten years and have been pleased with the service and the food quality.

This place is prefect for every possible occasion. Coworkers and I meet here once a week to wind down and enjoy each other outside if work. Lunch time couple get busy. Would recommend ordering ahead of time. Parking lot could be bigger.

Salsa waa funny tastinglike really acidic and menu was very hard to readhad to read description on every iten each nenu item was given a name thathad nothing to do with wat it is  , tacos wer ok but bland n salsa was horribleso couldnt put it on my tacos. Wifes carnitas had bones in it she didnt eat it

My Son and I were in the area volunteering at Three Square and decided to stop by here during our lunch break.  The parking lot was packed and we had to wait around 10 min for our table....this was at 12:10 pm, the worst time to be heading to lunch.  The wait was worth it though.  Once we were seated we browsed the menu and decided to order the Queso Fundido w/Chorizo appetizer ($6.95), Beef & Bean Chimichanga lunch special ($8.25), and Pollo Amador lunch special ($10.25).  I also asked the waiter if the cook could put together a really spicy Habanero Salsa for us....he said sure.    We were served complimentary Chips, Salsa, and Beans while we waited for our food....+1.  The Salsa reminded me of the Salsa at Lindo/Bonito Michoacan.  I read the menu that had the story of Zapata, but couldn't find any connection between the restaurants.....the Salsa was that close to one another.  Anyway, it was really good.....had a nice kick to it.  The Chips weren't as fresh as I like them to be....but they were good.  After a short wait our Queso Fundido came out....again, it reminded me of the one at Lindo/Bonito Michoacan.  It was very delicious.  On top of the dish is an extremely hot Pepper....I think it's a grilled Jalapeno or Poblano (see pics)....whatever it is, I like it.  I ordered the Beef & Bean Chimichanga and it came out a few minutes later....along with the Habanero Salsa.  The Beef was shredded and very delicious, not greasy.  Sometimes when you order a Beef Chimichanga it can be very greasy....not here.  It was a nice size too.....must be their lunch portion.  The Habanero Salsa was really spicy....just how I like it!  It added to the flavor.  My dish also came with Guacamole & Sour Cream and a side of Refried Beans & Rice.....all very good.  My Son enjoyed his Pollo Amador.  He gave me a bite to try it out.  It is Chicken marinated in Amador Sauce (whatever that is).  The Sauce had a slightly sweet tomatoey flavor to it.....it was very good.  Overall, it was a nice lunch.  Will we return?  If we're in the area and in the mood for some Mexican Food....you can count on it.

i loved their food!!!!!!! Amazing worth the price!!! I got some chille rellenos!!! And it was the bomb!!!!!!!! The atmosphere is great!!! amazing customer service!!! I definitely recommend coming here! Its amazing!!!!

I had dinner here a couple days ago and it was delicious. The mole sauce was great and the chicken was tender and juicy. The service was excellent, everyone was friendly and wore a smile on their face. I really enjoyed and appreciated the fact that this restaurant gives free chips, salsa and beans for dipping! In addition to that, the server even brought my son a cup of fideo soup for free ( he mentioned kids receive a free cup). I thought this was very nice of the restaurant staff and owner(s). I will definitely come back here and recommend it to others.
Loved this hidden gem! Definitely felt like I was at home. Customer service was amazing
Such a wonderful restaurant. I had the steak de cognac and that was super bomb!! The sangria is really good as well.  I loved the love music during dinner. It was a great environment!

Came with my family to eat at this restaurant their service is not that great,  their food is ok I paid $123 waited over an hour and a half for my food to come to our table, they try to make it up with singing a happy birthday song and bringing fried ice cream with some Churros that does not make it okay. I just left and not really happy with this place they did not even bother to give a discount, not satisfied with their service and not coming back.

A laid back and relaxed vibe. With prompt and courteous servers (I was served by Roberto). Delicious food; the organic margaritas taste just like the ones I make at home. Definitely recommend and will be returning.

Went for dinner for the second time on the one on craig rd , parking is bad bad  and the food was not so hot . Asked for a chile Verdi  burrito and it looked like a enchilada rolled on my plate . Was bad food  I have had better Mexican food at other places . Won't be going back and also pricey they raised their prices on some dishes that are valued at 2 or 3 dollars less .

Woo Hoo! I finally found a mexican resturant that is good in this town after 8 years of searching. Too bad it is on the opposite side of town. I loved the atmosphere and music. The chips, salsa and bean dip was sooo good I could not stop myself.The chili verde was so tender and full of flavor and the margaritas were fresh and not made with crappy sweet & sour. I will be back hopefully soon!

The best Mexican, hands down.   For starters, the homemade chips, salsa and beams are incredible. I don't even like retried beans, and I couldn't stop eating them. The salsa is thicker and slightly spicy - delish.   Margaritas are some of the best that you will let past your lips. Whether you prefer frozen or on the rocks, they are delightful and hard to refuse a refill.   Fideo soup. Fideo soup! This soup will keep you coming back for more, as they have truly ramped up the flavor. It is perfectly clear that they have poured love into the broth. It's delicious!  Do not get the tacos al pastor if you want to be able to eat them somewhere else. The flavor is knock-you-on-your-ass good. The meat bursts on your tastebuds just before the pineapple sweetness starts to tango. It's phenomenal. I will never be able to order this anywhere else.   The service was impeccable. The staff constantly checking and asking you how you are enjoying it, refilling beverages and truly interested in your visit. They will box your food for you, and everything is fine with a genuine smile. The live music on Friday nights brings together the circle of authenticity.   So where is the fifth star? In the non-existent parking lot. This is the only improvement that needs to be made. We parked at the gas station, and we're lucky to get the last spot on the whole block.   We're stoked that this place is right down the street from us, cuz we will be back - frequently!

I really enjoyed this place. I had the combo number 3. It came with a burrito, taco, enchilada, rice, beans, and a soup before the meal for $13.50. It was an awesome portion and I took about half of it home. Definitely a good deal. The ambiance of this was also nice. Lights were dim, candle on the table, earthy colors, lots of decorations, live solo guitar player playing music. Huge menu, lots of choices. Overall authentic Mexican restaurant that provided a good deal and pleasant dining experience.

The ultimate Mexican food.  Saw the reviews and had to try it to beleive it.  The service was very good and waiters/waitress were very attentive and courteous.  Once the food arrived, it was very appealing, served and tasted the bomb.  Im convinced this is the best Mexican food here.

We heard a lot of goods things about this place and have been wanting to try it . Finally did and from the  beginning to the end the experience was awsome. Great quick service . They are on top of it and great food, I got the pork torta. I will definitely be coming back. A must try place.

Tip the guitar man he is awesome, along with everything else about this establishment.  Huge tequila selection, cute and friendly barkeeps and super cool staff.  AWSOME draft beer selection and reasonably priced menu.  I say stop in and try to prove me wrong.

Viva Zapata's has been our go-to Mexican restaurant since '09. Why haven't I reviewed them?  Because I'm selfish :)  You can't go wrong here. Anything and everything is good on their menu. Try not  to have too much of the complimentary chips, salsa and beans or you'll run out of space for your main dish. My little one prefers to have her birthday dinner here every year. She loves the attention and of course the birthday churros!  Service is always top notch. Ask for Jesus, he is awesome. Can't complain about anything, really. If you do go for dinner, I suggest making a reservation because it can get really crowded.
I love this restaurant and the authentic look and atmosphere. Definitely a nice place to take a date and enjoy great food!
Great drinks, good decor, the chips came out warm, the soup that comes with every meal was great, the fresh made tortillas were amazing. I'm really impressed, definitely 5 stars, very cool!

This Mexican food did not disappoint!   From the start with chips,  bean dip and some awesome roasted tomato salsa. ..so good!   Could fill up on that alone!   Then the meal was great.   Had some tacos that hot the spot.   Would go back for this chips and dip in a heart beat!

Muchas Gracias Viva Zapatas for the Military Discount! Emiliano would be proud!  This restaurant is located near Nellis AFB and I've passed by it a million times.  From the outside it looks like a small bar type restaurant but surprisingly it's a nice little decorated place that serves up some great meals!  Chips and salsa were very good and you also get a side of hot dipping beans.  The service was so wonderful.  Speedy and friendly and between the waiter and the bus boy they were always checking in on us and refilling our iced teas.  We ordered off the lunch menu and everything was under $10.  I had the enchiladas and they were tasty and full of flavor. The Tortas here are wonderful (Mexican sandwich-mmm delicious).  I'm so glad we finally stopped in and I can take it off my bookmarks list and put it on my "Regular's" list because I will be back!  Viva Zapata!  What a great name!  Military discount (for Active Duty member only) w/ valid ID.

Surprise, surprise....weird! Ok so we passed this place everyday on the way home for 11 months and each time I say, ugh I just CAN'T eat next to a gas station or it looks ghetto. LOL OOOOO How wrong I was. So I gave in and we decided to eat there. O.M.G. Yum! I got the green pork plate, taco, enchilada and burrito. YUM! The staff was friendly, food was perfect, I love their bean and salsa sauces with the chips! Only bad thing is the Cadillac Margarita was THE best drink I've had in a while. Should be because the drink alone was $18!!! #$%$%^ yea....no prices on the menu always mean $%^$%^& on the bill....but other than that I'd go back for sure!
First time here and let me tell you it's one of the best Mexican food places I ever been. Food was delicious and service and excellent. I will definitely be back soon.

Ok so the quality of food seems to decrease with every time we go there. I don't know but the last 2 times I went to Viva Zapatas, I left the restaurant a little disappointed. Today we tried the Nachos and they were not that good for close to $10. I have had better ones at Robertos.   Also, last time we were there and asked for military discount, the guy told us they give discount only if we are in uniform. After we asked him to go ask the manager he came back with a split check and wanted to give only my husband the 10%!!! WHAT? Then I said, well I have an ID too and then he had to go and fix the bill again.
This place is beyond amazing!!! It's authentic Mexican food! The place is so clean and the waiters are very nice and helpful.  Next time were in Vegas, we're here!!!!

I just order an enchilada to go and when I get home it doesn't taste good too dry and no flavor I'm only 4mins away thinking of finding a good 1 around the house but this place is not for me thank you and I won't be back

Finally -- made it to VZ tonight.  Had the guac -- yep, they had tomatoes, so rolled the dice...feelin' fine!  The margs were great, took PA's advice about the sarandeado sauce, too -- but had it on the shrimp...if you've not had it before, it's such a treat, particularly with their homemade flour tortillas - yowza.    We also took the advice of Chris R --ordered two shrimp tacos -- but they were not in a league I'd consider worth reordering.    And we had an a la carte relleno -- which was damn good (I'm a serious green chili fan).   The menu is huge.  The bar is, too.  The dining room isn't that big, but we got there at 6:30 tonight (Friday) and sat right down.    Let's chat a second about where it is -- going north, you'll exit Craig Road -- and that's badly marked...(seriously, just remember, to take the exit after Cheyenne.)  Then you'll turn right at the end of the ramp, but you'll need to turn left at the first light -- then take an immediate right into the parking lot with the Pilot on your left...  trust me, finding the street number is impossible.  The menu is very similiar to the other Michoacans -- which means you'll get bean dip and salsa with your chips when you sit - and the other thing I've found pretty consistent about the Michoacans is that service is really terrific.  They're eager to please, happy to replace anything if it's not to your liking -- and the prices are reasonable.    All in all, for a 110 degree day in Vegas, a trip to Craig Road for a frozen marg and some tasty dishes, that I honestly hadn't ventured to try at the others, made us happy.  There are certainly plenty of interesting dishes on the menu that caught my eye -- so I'd go back - and since we've got a Michoacan pretty much down the street (Viva), that's saying something.     Gracias, Poly.
Great food , and amazing margaritas . We had a discrepancy in our bill and the Manager Ramon was quick to rectify this situation . We will be back . * Happy Hour 2 for 1 prices.
order the coca-cola pork, you're welcome.

Food was excellent. A little pricey. This is where the hubby wanted to go for his birthday. It's a ways from our house in Centennial. We all liked our meals, but it's not somewhere I would drive so far to get. If you're near by check it out.

Wow what an awesome meal. I had the chicken cognac and my husband had the rib eye with cognac. Very delicious!!! The meat was tender on the steak. The chips and salsa were accompanied by beans and fideo. The fideo was so good, very soup like, and very delicious. The main thing I would want to express is the attention to detail, especially the service was 10 stars. the staff all works together and they are on point. We never had to worry about our glasses being empty. The same thing with the chips and salsa and bean dip those never were empty. This place deserves all the stars asked then some. You will not be disappointed coming here to eat.

I came here for breakfast on my birthday and it was great! I had the chilaquiles rojos with the 2 eggs! Delicious! The chips and salsa with bean dip were excellent! The staff was prompt and friendly! The menu gives you the history of Emiliano Zapata which was entertaining to read about. Will definitely go back to try some dinner entrees!

I love this place there pollo sarandeado I think I got that right is the best tasteing plate ever. Usually I get full with there chips bean dip and salsa and only eat half my plate, but this place is very good. ohh and I always take there flan to go I have never tasted a better flan than theres.

4 1/2 stars. I arrived during the late lunch hour which was a mistake. I parked in the back and was getting looks from the tennant so decided to move. I lucked out BC it was close to 1:00 and someone was leaving.   Once seated I received their signature warm bean dip, salsa and tortilla chips - so addicting. For my entree I selected the lengua with red sauce rice and beans. The portion was generous and the taste was delish. The home made corn tortillas hit the spot as I made my own lengua tacos.    The service here was spot on - friendly and refills without request. I can understand why Zapatas Mexican restaurant was voted best of Las Vegas and will certainly return.

Hungry for a grilled chicken salad on a Friday night and stumbled onto this place through Yelp. Phoned in the order and had great customer service. I ordered the Supreme salad with grilled chicken and asked if they had Chipotle Ranch dressing to go with it. She said no, but we can make it. Very accommodating and the food was delicious!  The home made chipotle ranch was the bomb! Overall excellent food and service. I'll be going back before I leave Vegas!

Yes,  Viva! Zapata's is right.  I have been to this place 4 times so far.  I live in California otherwise I would be there every week.  The food is incredible.  Authentic mexican food, with tons of flavor!  The service is superb.  Chips and salsa are on point.  They also bring you bean dip and fideo as a starter. Order the guacamole, they make it table side from scratch.  Real avocados, jalapenos, lime, garlic, cilantro, etc.  It is soo tasty.  I have been for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Everything I have eaten from seafood to machaca has been great.  I will go there everytime I visit Las Vegas. You should try this place as a good alternative away from the strip and alot more economical.  P.S.  Homemade tortillas!!  That's reason enough to visit this place!
The table side guacamole is amazing! The vegetable fajita was very good and the fresh tortillas that they make on site are delicious!
Great Mexican food with great service. The lunch specials are a steal but it's crazy packed at lunch time so go early or you won't be able to park let alone get in.

This was my first visit here and it might just be my last. I decided to eat at Viva Zapatas over Que Mas mexican restaurant and I totally regretted it.  I ordered the 2 tacos combination plate with rice and beans and it was an epic fail, because this place is stingy with their meat. No joke!   There was about 2oz of meat in both tacos combined and it was disappointing to say the least. No flippin wonder there was an avalanche of lettuce in my tacos.   I paid about $12 for a crap load of rice, beans and taco shell and very very little meat. In all honesty I hate it when restaurants are stingy with their ingredients.  I was still hungry so I ended up ordering 2 additional tacos and 1 tamale and made sure to tell the waiter to ask the cook to put more meat this time around.  When the tacos and tamale came out I would quickly find out that this time around wasn't going to be any better. Even though there was more meat it tasted horrible. The beef in the tacos were super dry and the tamale was probably the worst I've ever had in my life... seriously.  Overall this was probably the worst mexican food I've ever had and I'm just wondering why in the heck it's a 4 star joint.   In a nutshell this was memorable in a very very bad way and I'm definitely crossing this joint off my foodie list for good.  Thanks but no thanks VZ!

Had lunch here based on helpers. One of best chili rellanos I've had in a long time and the chicken taco salad was very good but the soup was lousy so pass on that... nice place to come too if your passing by

Authentic great tasting food combined with amazing service makes this place worth a visit! I had the combination platter which included a crispy chicken taco, Green chille pork burrito, and a beef enchilada (including rice and beans). Every bite was savored and have absolutely no complaints about this place. My co-worker drank about 6 horchatas being that as soon as she was done with one, the server would immediately grab another (Now that's service)!

Great food and wonderful service!  Nothing to complain about the Restaurant itself, the outside area unfortunately is not the most safest part of town. But if you venture out to North Las Vegas I recommend you stop by for some delicious authentic style Mexican food.

My favorite local restaurant in Vegas! I love this place. Their homemade flour tortillas are fantastic, and so is the salsa and bean dips that come complimentary with every meal.   Go at lunchtime Mon-Fri if you're looking to save a few bucks - their lunch menu starts at $8 or so.

We heard about this place and decided we had to try it out. Drove way the hell out Craig in N Vegas to find it. Place is dark inside and decorated with a cross between Mexican Revolutionary and Farmer. Staff was very friendly and actually very good. We ordered appetizer of the Quesadilla that was damn good. Also the chips, salsa and bean dip that was great as well. I had the Enchilada, Taco and Burrito combo. This was good, only drawback was kinda room temperature, not hot. The parts that I ate were very tasty. Scary when the meat is only room temperature, so doubtful that I will return.

I really do enjoy this place. As a business traveler if you find yourself returning to the same spot rather than seeking out new locations, you know that there has to be something special about it.   Lets start with the salsas. Obviously homemade you get a red salsa with a bit of a kick and a refried bean salsa. I'm not the biggest refried bean gal, but I do really like this salsa. Last time I was here I finished that bowl...  I had 2 enchiladas with mole sauce and carne which the meat was perfectly seasoned and the cheese was stretching out of the enchiladas like a perfectly melted cheese should. Mole sauce had great flavor and punch and elevated the enchiladas to a new level.  Service was great, the lone guitarist was playing all night long and everyone was super friendly. Great atmosphere and highly recommended.

The guacamole at Viva Zapatas is absolutely delicious, made form scratch, and made to order. It's a meal in itself!!!   You get bottomless chips so be careful and save room for the delicious pork, beef, chicken and seafood options Viva's menu offers.  NOTE: parking is limited especially during busy hours, additional parking can be found behind Zapatas.   Staff: courteous and friendly   Seating: only indoor, plenty of room for large parties. Bar area has stools and seating for approximately 20 people.   Full bar, lots of tequila brands.   Dress code: casual   Menu: lots of options! I've never had a bad meal here. I'm a big fan of the carne asada, and the chimichanga.    Service: the service is usually quick, but at peak hours (lunch) you may have a little bit of a wait.  Make sure you've got more than an hour to eat, if you're going to stop by at lunch time.   Bottom line, if you're looking for good Mexican food this should be one of your stops.
We love this place! :) The food is awesome. I had the ceviche and practically licked the plate. It is the perfect summer time food. Will definitely be back!

Soup was an unexpected surprise, tacos came arranged in holders, and price was very reasonable: The cost of sushi for one fed two of us.  Service was great.  I've only been here once so far, but I'll definitely be back.

We're visiting from San Diego and read the reviews from previous customers and knew we had to try it. THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT. The service was top notch and never let my drink get below half. The servers were very attentive and polite. The food was excellent very generous portions and very tasty. The chips, beans, and salsa was really good and so was the complimentary soup. Next time we're in Vegas again we will definitely stop in.
Longest wait ever.... Won't be doing lunch there again I sure hope the food is good!!!

Viva Margaritas! I ventured to this spot for Happy Hour with some co-wokers one Friday afternoon. We chose this place specifically for their HH drink specials...2 for 1 margaritas! Ay yai yai!! Annnd, they were actually tasty...not too much sweet and sour, just the right amount! Unfortunately there are no HH food special (tear). : (   Coming from San Diego, it has been difficult to find authentic Mexican food, but Viva Zapatas was one of the better ones I've found so far in Vegas.  I ordered the taco plate with beans and rice. Unfortunately I can't recall the three different taco meats I ordered, but I remember all of them being tasty. The rice was prepared well, but my favorite were the refried beans and homemade chips they brought out when we sat down...yummy!!! Another traditional touch that I appreciated was the fideo soup that accompanied my meal. I could have slurped that soup all night....delicious!!   The ambiance was enjoyable as well. Traditional colors and decor with classic Mexican tunes in the background. I believe the server mentioned that they have occasional live musical performances, so if that peaks your interest I would call prior to confirm. The service was good, nothing above and beyond, but certainly friendly. The only downside of this place is that it is fairly pricey for traditional Mexican food. Thank goodness for their HH margarita specials!

My hopes were very high with the rave reviews. I'm still on the hunt for the best carne asada burrito in Vegas.   Carne asada burrito Zapatas special- 3 stars. The special has sour cream, guacamole, and some other stuff inside. It was okay...I've had better.  Beef chimichanga- 5 star. It was my friend's dish and it was def better than mine. It was fried to perfection and the shredded beef was delicious!   Free chips and salsa- super super good. I almost want to say their chips are the best I've ever had. I keep saying that it seems, but I swear these are reaalllllllly good chips. The salsa was good, only because it has a major kick to it.   Service was excellent.   I'm giving 3.5 stars. I'll be back for the chips and the chimichanga someday.
I waited an hour and a half to be served I saw three tables that came in 20 minutes after I did and left way before I even left very unprofessional but the food is still really good
Best mexican food hands down! Every time food is super tasty, great portions, & cozy atmosphere. Waiters are always attentive & love that there is always a musician playing to keep the vibe alive.

Me and my fianc√© come to eat here every other weekend. we love to sit at the bar since the service there is great. The food is delicious. I have probably tried every shrimp plate on their menu and they are all good but my fave is Shrimp Fajitas! you have got to try those if you go here. Their margaritas can be a bit strong but that's  not a problem with me... For sure they get a 10/10 from me. :)

We read all the reviews so we had to try for ourselves! I was craving some legit Mexican. I ordered the Carne a La Tampiquena and my husband had the Pork Carnitas. It was good but maybe I expected way TOO much from all the reviews. I enjoyed my cheese enchilada (that was served on the side of my meal) and margarita the most! They have a great happy hour deal and beers on draft. I liked that their tortillas are freshly made (you can see the woman towards the back cooking them). However, I walked away feeling like I missed something. Great service, good food but maybe I ordered the wrong thing since everyone else is raving?!
Some of the best Mexican food I ever had anywhere.  Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. You can't go wrong here. Ate and drank here twice in two days and I will be back next time in Vegas.

First impression was nice.  The hostess was very friendly and professional. She greeted us and offered us a carrier for our babies car seat so that was a plus.  She sat us down and not to long after we had our waiter take our drinks. They handed us chips and salsa right away. We placed our order and munched on the chips and salsa which was pretty yummy.  But the wait just to get our food was pretty lengthy. We ended up getting full off of the food because of the wait. So when our food finally came it was nice and hot.  I ordered the steak enchilada mole. One bite and it was so overly stuffed with cheese.  Almost to the point where it made me sick. I could bearly taste the mole.  I Know that I will never ordered this again. I also had the Carne asada salad. It was overpowered with lime. It had no flavor. Another thing I will not order again.  My son had the steak cognac.  I took a bite and it was good they cooked it med rare perfect. My husband had the shrimp and it was cooked just right also and there was good flavor.  If it was based off service alone I would put another star.  Maybe I'll come back and try a different item but so far I was not impressed with my food.

Such great food here!!! We have been coming for years and they never disappoint. The margaritas are wonderful and I love their fish tacos! Salsa comes with beans on the side too! The live music is a plus!!

From now on my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. Not only for its authenticity but its friendly service and of course the rich and savory dishes. Give it a try and your palate will thank you. Just saying. :)
Great food and service. Cadillac margarita obscenely priced at $17.50.
Best queso fondito with chorizo i have had in Las Vegas. Good mojito's and margaritas. Friendly staff. Good atmosphere. Pretty good al pastor but not the best. Would come to this restaurant again.

Nice place to go for "antojitos mexicanos". Real Mexican Food. When no time for grilling I usually stop here for carne asada patron. Delish. Not to mention their margaritas!  One of the best places to go for frozen margaritas.  Only down side is the wait time. This place is always crowded but the wait is well worth it.  Customer service not quite the best but good food.

Atmosphere, Service and Food!  This place hits the marks on all three, from the moment that you enter the place you feel instantly relaxed, like your in an old mexican cantina, the service is top-notch! very team oriented, from the second that you take your seat a server is getting your drinks while another  is bringing you chips with two types of dips which are both awesome btw followed by yet another person with tomato soup! really well orientated. The food is delicious, I've had the fish tacos and camarones adelita there both great! bursting with flavor served in oversized portions, come hungry and be prepared to roll out of this place. My only gripe is the prices which can be a little on the high side, the camarones adelita is almost in the $20 range.  All in all, some of the best Mexican food I've ever had.

My wife took me here for a date night & over all it was a very nice experience. The good things were the main courses & the service. The down side was the taste of the salsa that came complimentary with chips & some refried beans. The salsa had a very strange taste but since it was free we didn't see any reason to complain. My wife had the Shrimp enchiladas & they tasted great, I had the Lengua Revolution & it was friggin awesome. Lengua can either be really good or really bad. At Zappata it was wonderful, so tender you could have. Lien on it to cut it. Overall a wonderful dinner & atmosphere.

This place was a complete surprise and really really good.  Service was excellent, the food to include the free chips, salsa, and bean dip was excellent.  I love that they make their own tortillas.  This is the type of place you'd find in San Diego.  I can't stop thinking about it since we went a few days ago, so we are ordering carry-out tonight for dinner.  Excellent!

I have to be real and blunt I absolutely love this place but there are some big con's that forced me to dock some stars.  Atmosphere:5/5 It doesn't get more authentic than this. When you walk into this restaurant you feel like your in Mexico. It looks like an old Mexican tavern. Dim lighting with a guy in the corner with a guitar jamming away. Honestly the vibes of this place was awesome! The bar was more than fully stocked. With your "American vodka's" and a WIDE WIDE selection of Tequila's.   Service: 3/5 The service felt very homey, like I had a Mexican mother cooking me home made Mexican food. The food was very wholesome in HUGE portions. I literally had no Idea where to begin. So I started in the middle and ate my way out. LOL Service at the bar could've been a bit better. I went during peak dinner hours so I guess that's why they neglected us. I noticed my group didn't get any bar tables stands for our plates like other groups so we ate directly on the bar.  Also our complimentary salsa, chips, and pinto bean dip ran low. I wasn't sure If I could as for more because it was complimentary "well so I thought it was"   Food: 4/5 First the salsa, chips, and pinto bean dip. OMG was super delicious. The salsa was average but the bean dip was very tasty. but don't fill up on the chips. Next comes the pre dinner soup, not sure what it was but it was very bland. It looked spicy but it wasn't. Now the meal, it was very heavy, when I say heavy. I mean fatty, cheesy, and oily. I literally had to push around the cheese to get to anything. It was EVERYWHERE kind of an over load. The cheese enchilada lacked flavor, and on my 3 combo plate (1 tostada, 1 beef taco, 1 enchilada). The beef on the taco was shredded like pulled pork. It seemed more like a carnita. The tostada was very fresh because it was topped off with a big glob of guacamole. YUMMMM   Drinks: 4/5 The drinks were just right. Not too strong, not too weak. A perfect blend. I ordered a margarita because I felt.. I needed to indulge fully into Mexican culture. It was a perfect combo to my meal.   Pricing: 3/5 My order was $13.95 a bit pricy for the Area of town it's in. But It was understandable because the food was good. The atmosphere complimented the food well. Plus it came with complimentary salsa and chips, with also this intro dinner soup.  Suggestions/Advice:  - Don't go during peak dinner hours if you want impeccable service. - Don't fill up on a lot of chips,salsa, and pinto bean dip. - Portions are huge  - TRY THE PINTO BEAN DIP it was heaven!!! - Parking might be difficult its a very small limited area.

One of my favorite Mexican food places!  The service varies, but the food is always delicious.  Very flavorful and prepared well.  My current favorite: the shrimp tacos.  The tortillas are made on site; I could just eat them plain, they are that good.    They offer a military discount for cardholders and there is a children's menu.

We went there for lunch.  It was not too busy, but service was a bit slow.   We were brought a red salsa that was probably the worst salsa I have had.   It was not just me.   Everyone in the group thought it tasted like an old cleaning rag.   We asked the waiter about the salsa, but he said the peppers are roasted and that's how it is.   Requested a green sauce instead, which never came.   Someone in the group ordered chilaquiles which were very tasty.   However the meat that she ordered with the chilaquiles looked and tasted more like jerky.    I had the fajitas which were good, not great.  Overall, was not impressed.
Not great lighting inside.  Great live music, awesome staff, & delicious food.  Save your appetite for fried ice cream.

Had dinner there the other night, and the place was packed. After 15 minutes we had a table. The chips and salsa as well as the bean dip were really good, and all made fresh.  We had the fajitas 1 chicken and one beef.  Both were good, and the fresh flour tortillas made right behind us were very good.  They give you complimentary soup which was just meh, but no charge = no complaints.  All in all would go back.
This would be a great place to open a restaurant! Holy crap waited 45 minutes for tacos.. Cooks can only do 1 order at a time?  Enough with the chips and salsa already

We went here last night with friends on recommendations we had seen. It was pretty good and the menu is very extensive but it is on the "pricey" side. The place is nice and clean and tastefully decorated but is also a bit on the dark side. It was hard reading  the menus.   OK back to the food. I mean come on people it's just Mexican food. Most of the specialty dishes ran from $16.99 to $18.99. The normal Mexican combination plates were prices in the $10.99 to $13.99 range.
I've been here a few times and their margaritas are the best. They have two for one margarita happy hours and most of the time, the food is fantastic.

I love giving high ratings when it is deserved and this place gets it. I'd give a five but 5 has got to be reserved for the "nothing I say will do this place justice" eatery. This dish filled me up. Company is great. Full tummy. Super pleasant atmosphere. I would come here again.

Sat at the bar because they were very busy at 330 pm. A good sign. Place was full of Mexicans, another good sign. Nice Mexican draft beer selection. Good chips and dip. The food was very good and service was very good. Had live music as well. Atmosphere is also good.

The best Mexican food in Las Vegas hands down. In addition to the best food, the staff is very friendly, professional and always have a smile when serving you. My wife and I eat there as often as we can and we always leave there full and very satisfied. Oh ya, love the live music, this restaurant is awesome. You guys keep up the good work and my wife and I and our family and friends will continue to eat there. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

This honestly is a little, hidden gem of a restaurant in north Las Vegas. I work right down the street so this is usually my go to place on pay day Friday's.  They have tons of lunch specials but my favorites are the taco salad and camarones con rayas y crema. The taco salad is huge and comes with everything you'd ever desire. I always mix in some of the salsa too in order to spice it up a bit. The camarones are probably my number one favorite, but they're a bit pricier around $11. This plate comes with rice, beans and your choice of tortillas. The shrimp has a creamy sauce along with some peppers. Honestly it's so good, you just have to try it!   The lunch specials here also come with a drink and one refill which is nice. The food has always been great with anything I try and I especially love their bean dip which comes complementary with any meal.   The only reason I'd give them a four star instead of five is how the service can be shoddy sometimes. It's either very good and quick or terribly slow and not very attentive. I guess it just depends what day of the week you come. Either way I'll always be back for more!
Came at 330pm. It's now 355pm. There are 2 other tables that gave customers, still no waiter. Food is bomb though, I've been here when it was busy and had better service.

So if you have 50 dollars to kill on yourself take it to this place, they have some awesome mexican food! like real mexican food, hey im not a novice to mexican food, but this was just fantastic.. actually it tasted better than the food i had down in cabo...  So If you like mexican food and you want a good well portioned mean go here! its pretty awesome!  Oh and the tortillas are had made right in front of you!! just like in OLD TOWN SD.. perty Legit.
I love this place. The food is awesome, there is live music and micheladas are on point! I usually sit at the bar and the ladies are friendly and attentive. Two thumbs up!

I dined here with some colleagues while in town for work.  We chose it due to good Yelp reviews.  Our reviews were a little more mixed.  We arrived on a weeknight, and I inquired about happy hour at the hostess stand.  The hostess didn't know if it was happy hour, and had to go check.  She confirmed that it was happy hour, but then took off again, and the three of us stood awkwardly in the entrance waiting for a while for her to seat us.  It didn't seem so busy to warrant that wait, but we waited a while to order and to be served throughout the night.  Our food was good, except for the ceviche appetizer.  Something about it was not right - it lacked that nice bite of lime, and the fish was not prepared like I'm used to - the consensus at the table was that it was a miss - and most of it was still in the dish when we left.  The pastor tacos were good - they had pineapple which is often left off of pastor tacos, the table side guac was a nice treat, and my friend's chicken dish was enjoyed by everyone at the table.  We also had a great server - very friendly and helpful.  The uneven service definitely affected our experience, but I would still try it again because I think they have a good menu with a nice variety of authentic dishes.

Favorite place ever!! Been coming here since 2002 !  Excellent service & amazing food everytime !  The know my family & our favorite dishes whenever we go. Really wonderful place. The owner has done a wonderful job.
Amazing food....! We had Jose as our server and he was amazing also!!! We are from California and we will be back next time to visit again
This place is by far one of my favorite neighborhood Mexican restaurant. The staff is super friendly and the food is great. You should definitely try their preparada it is delish!!

Looking at all my reviews you're gonna think I have a soft spot for Mexican food and you'll be right! The wait can be a little long because of the limited seating, parking can be scarce by Vegas standards and neighborhood it is in you usually wouldn't want to be caught in after dark but the margaritas and tortillas are really worth the wait and the scarce dark parking lot. Advice to management: maybe try to better utilize the parking space? Add some lights in the parking lot?

My friend and I are both chefs and just got off work and my friend who WAS a loyal customer for 6 years recommend we go here for dinner. I was early and the service was great I got a drink and my chips very fast. Once my friends got there we ordered margaritas with an extra shot and they tasted like lime-ade not 1 drop of tequila so we sent it back. Once we received our margaritas again nothing changed it we couldn't taste any tequila. We ordered our dinner and it took forever to come out literally about 30 to 40 minutes we went through atleast 5 bowls of chips and dip. The buster Oscar was the ONLY reason we didn't get up and leave and he is the only reason this place is getting 1 star. Oscar was very engaging and entertaining he made us laugh and made our whole night! Once our food came I got the tacos de carne asada and it literally had no flavor or seasoning it tasted like I was chewing rubber I had to put guac and ton of salt I even dug in my margarita to get my lime to give it some taste. We were highly disappointed and to top it off my friend who is retired military and has been getting a military discount for the last 6 years they refused to give it to her because she wasn't currently active duty! We complained to the manager and he wasn't the most friendly or considerate of all managers wasn't much help at all he did reluctantly give us a military discount. The food was mediocre the service was decent the management was horrible I'd rather spend my money on taco bell... but Oscar is amazing that's the only good thing about this place... I will not be coming back and I doubt my friends will either
Good customer service, good atmosphere with music in the background and great foods! This place has a festive vibe that will make your experience really enjoyable.

This place is ok ... Not really worth it for the price though ..theres many mexican restaurants that are in vegas that are way better then this spot and about same price if not cheaper ... In that being said i dont think the food is horrible ...i just think it doesnt match up with the bill ... Personally i defently rather hit up another spot with more bang for its buck in taste .. Lil bit on the salty side ... But like i said food isnt bad its just ok ...

Simply the best authentic Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, speaking as an LV native. Probably not for gringos looking for a Amer/Mex franchise but if you want great food and Margaritas, it's at the top. Try the chicken coreteado or a dozen other pollo specialty dishes. The Javiers margarita is very good as well. Definitely worth the drive!
One of the MORE authentic mexican food places on this side of town.  I love the birria there.  It never disappoints.

Got so excited when my husband said we could come again after church today! We ordered chile rellenos, gauc dip, chicken taco, enchilada, beef taco, tostada with guac, and some other stuff, but the main point is EVERYTHING IS GOOD! This was my second trip and we loved it;)
Zapatas has decent food, but this review is about my To Go order.... $7.50+ for a "medium" salsa.... and No Chips!#! It was far short of a Medium. and No Chips?? Boo!!

First off, we are from San Diego and are absolute Mexican Food snobs, it must be authentic or we don't bother going. I can't stand the touristy mexican food on the strip so we were excited to try this small place off the beaten path in North Vegas. We went to Viva Zapatas based on positive Yelp reviews and recommendations from the locals and this place did not disappoint. If you are asking yourself if this place is worth the 20 minute drive from the strip, my answer is emphatically "HELL YES!" The tableside Guac is crazy awesome, fresh homemade hot tortillas and chips. Bean dip, salsa and soup are complementary too! I had the carne asada plate and it was on-par with the best I've had in San Diego. She had the Shrimp Fajitas and they were plump, grilled to perfection and plentiful. We will be visiting again soon.

This is a great place for great Mexican foods. They serve wonderful queso fundido with peppers! The margaritas are not super sweet. Meals come with fresh soups. Every dish I've tried has been wonderful!

One of my favorite local restaurants. The service is always quick and the food is wonderful. Their variety of food is definitely a delight for the senses. The atmosphere is always clean and the staff is amazing.

My husband and I went here for our date night! & oh my god, the service was beyond excellent! Our food was amazing! They made our guacamole in front of us which I thought was awesome! The staff was quick on getting our drinks and even refilling them along with our chips and salsa! We definitely will be going again. The restaurant is pretty small, but the service and food make up for it!

FD dinner at Viva Zapata's in NLV... Service was horrid... supposed to have soup with entree, they said "You didn't get soup?"... Waited for butter for tortilla and water so food got cold...and topper was they could have cared less... $39 tab (no booze) and NO attempt to make things right... Sad part of the story was table side guac was GREAT... can't tell about the rest of my meal as it was ICE COLD when I finally got water and butter... Viva Zapata's gave me a ROTTEN Father's Day dinner... Ole!

Second time there.  The first was like 3 years ago.   Unfortunately this time left a bit more to be desired.   The hostess was very nice and welcoming,  our waiter not so much for some reason.. The other members of the wait staff were very attentive but our main waiter just sucked.... I wanted to order appetizers while we looked over the menu.  He disappeared so long that we just went ahead and ordered the main entree.  We didn't see him again until we were pretty much done.   I did mention to him I would've ordered apps if he were around. He simply walked away.   Steak fajitas were kind of chewy. My son had fried shrimp he said it was good.  Chips, salsa, beans, and noodle soup were all good.  My margarita was over priced and not that great....
Prompt polite service, clean booths, pleasant live music, fresh and fast food. Just the ticket for anyone at Nellis AFB. Interior nicer than exterior.

One of the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas! They have authentic cuisines. Just ask for their specialty for beef, chicken or pork. They will recommended what the popular menus are. Be aware that portions are big enough to share.

Came here after NASCAR for dinner with a group of 4. The restaurant is cozy and very well decorated with pictures of Zapata and the history that comes with that. The service was great, they give you chips beans and salsa while you wait. The sopa de Fideo reminds me of moms cooking. The waiter is nice and told us that they have a full bar but no drink menu. We ordered the mango margaritas. I appreciate the salt on the rim but they skipped the salt I guess. I ordered the chile colorado. It was impressive. We also ordered fried ice cream and it was devious. The place is very busy as it is popular. I also liked the dress of the workers and also the tortilla lady making fresh tortillas! Would love to return here but it's a bit far from my area.
This place is great , has great food , music there is nice , Ive been coming to this place since I was little , it's my favorite restaurant and the food is amazing

Can't believe it!  We have eaten here at least twice a month for a few years. ..  Totally happy with our standard breakfast order... We both get huevos rancheros.  Last 2 trips they can't even get the eggs even close.  Over medium means whites cooked and yolks runny.  Egg whites means no yolk!  Both epic fail! When we returned the RAW eggs the chef returned the eggs over hard.  brown and completely over cooked! The term egg whites suddenly is incomprehensible! So we got scrambled eggs.    He sent an obvious screw you because we complained.  They will never see another dime of business from us!

Awesome cheap Mexican fare a short drive from the Vegas strip.  Who knew?  We went a bit out of our way during a day trip (between visiting Red Rock Canyon and Hoover Dam) to check out this place on the recommendation of a friend, and we were not disappointed.    The food is nothing fancy, but it's real, and it's good.  The guac is a highlight - made tableside, fresh and flavorful (at about half of NYC prices for the same).  The atmosphere is festive and the service attentive.  A ton of locals/regulars is never a bad sign either.
Excellent meal, delightful decor, soft Spanish music. A taste of San Antonio,  far from home.

This is the best, most authentic, Mexican Restaurant Mexican in Las Vegas. My partner and I ordered the veggie fajitas which came with the best warm tortilla chips, salsa and bean dip. We also ordered the guacamole made table side.   The place is named after a famous Mexican activist who stood up for the people as the government was trying to steal their homes and land. The service is also excellent. Alejandro was our server and he was amazing. As was assistant, Cesar. Thank you both for an amazing culinary experience.

As long as you are looking for traditional Mexican food rather than Tex-Mex this place is wonderful. The service is top notch, the food is great, and the live music gives it a flare of excitement and authenticity.  A friend of mine introduced me to this restaurant a while back and ever since then I have been huge fan. They serve things you do not get at chain restaurants like their own specialty noodle soup, which is especially good during the winter season, refried beans as a chip dip, and a array of dishes that are mouth watering.   The inside is very small and it is more of a locals restaurant than a tourist place which means that it is cheaper cost wise and you get better service. Granted you might get put in a odd spot to eat but I have found that every sitting area offers something different to look at. I love to bring my out of town guest and friends here to eat because it offers such a large variety of food items to chose from and because they always leave satisfied.
Every time I dine at this restaurant the food is amazing and the service is spectacular! Probably the best Mexican restaurant in North Las Vegas! The lunch specials are great deals.

by far the best Mexican food I've eaten in a long time and I'm from the bay. I just moved to vegas and since we already ate here last time, I had the chicken mole which was amazing. The chicken was so tender and the mole sauce was perfectly seasoned. Tonight I tried the Camarones with the mushroom wine sauce which was on point. The prawns are huge from Mexico. Their chips and salsa are also delicious. I also love how attentive they are and how there is a guy singing and playing mexican music. Makes you feel like your in mexico. If you ever come to vegas,  Def try this place! You won't be disappointed!

This place is fantastic for lunch!  The food is very good, but what makes them stand out is their service.  Our glasses never got less than half full and the chips and salsa were refilled several times.  Try the #12 chicken lunch special, it is very tasty.

I like this place it's a wonderful place if you want to go with your family (with kids), friends, colleagues. This place is excellent and a great variety of menu items above and beyond the usual boring choices you would find anyplace else. Not to mention the amazing service.

Went to Viva Zapata's a couple weeks ago on the recommendation of a friend.  Every thing was tasty , we'll prepared , plentiful portions and our party of four all took some leftovers home in a doggy bag.  I tried the coca cola steak and really enjoyed it. I Also added a tostada it also was plentiful and the Pico de Gallo was the bomb.  The only reason that I'm not giving 5 stars is the service was a little bit slow even though we were doing dinner a little early and well outside their busy time.   I would recommend and return.

Just from walking in the place looked legit! GREAT service from to front door to the bar. Some of the best salsa I've had in a very very long time. Excellent food. Who says you need to go to Mexico to have some really good Mexican dishes. Their selection of tequila was massive .Great place a must try if ever in Vegas.

Not much parking and I hear there's always a wait. Never had a wait for a Mexican spot before. That's a by product of a small place and solid foot. Had the chicken and cactus. Definitely would get it again. Salsa and beans weren't bad. The chips werent my fav. Live music and traditional atmosphere. May come again if I'm in the area.

This place is soooo cute! The only reason I give it four stars is because our food took a little while to come out. People sat down waaaay after us and got their food before us. Not mad at all, but a little communication as to what was going on would have been nice. Our server JESUS was really sweet and had a great sense of humor! I'll be going back to try a different dish, as they have a HUGE menu!
Very good place for a bean and cheese burrito. We got it just passing though town. But it was all too notch. Lots a very local place, but The place is clean and the food is great.

Great food & service. Have driven by there for years and finally decided we needed to give it a try, glad we did.  Guacamole as a starter. Had the Chile Verde "Mauser", superb! Pork cooked to perfection, verde sauce tantalized my taste buds, some of the tastiest I have had anywhere.  Grandson's loved their meals and the fried ice cream.
Great guacamole and fresh flour tortillas. Enchiladas and steak Chile Colorado was very good.
Amazing Mexican food (and I don't even like Mexican food all that much!). Affordable prices. LOTS of food. Well seasoned. Great place.
In particular for not being in a great area this place is friggin sweet!  Salsa dynamite. Shrimp was excellent. Great Guac. Solid all around.

We were driving through on our way to Salt Lake City and stumbled across Viva Zapatas.  It was a wonderful find.  It seems to be a big favourite of locals, as it was almost full on a Sunday at 11:00 am.  Chips were brought to the table with salsa and bean dip.  The chips are so fresh, no mistaking them for store bought, and the dips truly tasty (salsa was a bit spicy).  We had Huevos Machaca with corn tortillas, so much meat that it was hard to find the eggs.  It was very tasty but I would have enjoyed a little more pico de gallo to add some texture.  Definitely worth the detour off the I-15
